loans.name: Jhoselyn

texts.es:
Jhoselyn, es soltera no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario; actualmente estudia en la universidad la carrera de Ingenieria Ambiental y por las tardes se dedica al doblado de cajas de carton de galletas en una fábrica de galletas y panes en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar un Equipo de Computacion  que es muy necesario para sus trabajos en la Universidad.
El sueño de Jhoselyn es acabar con sus estudios en la universidad  y poder ejercer su carrera  
Es primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jhoselyn is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents in the Ciudad Satélit area of El Alto city. She completed secondary school and today is studying environmental engineering at the university. In the afternoons she works folding cardboard boxes for cookies at a bread and cookie factory in El Alto. She needs the loan to buy a computer which is very necessary in her studies at the university. Jhoselyn's dream is to finish her university studies and be able to work in her chosen field. This is her first time seeking a loan from IMPRO and first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer that will help her with her university studies.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es casada y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primaria. Se dedida a la elaboracion y venta de sorteos (Suerte  sin Blanca ) vende en colegios , tiendas y otros. 
El crédito lo requiere para la comprar variedad de juguetes para asi poder armar sus sorteos   de ditintos modelos tanto para varon o mujer.y tener a disposiscion juguetes para asi poder cumplir con sus requerimientos 
El sueño de Elva es que sus sorteos se distribuyan a nivel nacional  
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elva is married, but she does not have children.  She lives in her own house, which is located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.  She has an elementary school education.  She makes and sells raffle tickets 'Suerte sin Blanca' [raffle in which everyone wins a prize] at schools, stores, and others.

She needs the loan to buy a variety of toys in order to be able to stock her raffles with different models, as much for boys as girls.  She will also do this to have toys available in order to be able to meet with the requirements.

Elva’s dream is that her raffles be distributed at a national level.

It is the third time that she has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy toys in order to continue with her raffle business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 55 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married, with four grown children. 

She engages in making tuba (coconut) wine and selling it to the community to help augment the income of her household.  She started her business  almost 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy empty bottles and containers and "tungog"  (which gives distinctive taste to the wine).

In the future, she hopes to expand her tuba wine business and increase her business profitability for the improvement of her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles and containers and a wine ingredient.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a brush hog.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 36 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married, with a two-year-old son. Her husband worked as a carpenter's helper to support their family. 

Isidra engages in farming. She grows and sells rice as a source of income. Her business started six years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, crop medicines, and a sprayer to gain more harvest.

 In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase her business profitability for her child's future .

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicine, and a sprayer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married, with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. She has two children who are in school.

Jasmin has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo de 61 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en una aldea de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de cargas de leña y de maíz y se levanta muy temprano para salir a vender su producto a la comunidad.
Don Lorenzo también sale a vender a otros lugares cercanos y sus clientas son señoras que venden tortillas así como también pulperías, para surtirles sus negocios de maíz.
Don Lorenzo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cargas de leña y maíz y poder así tener la suficiente mercadería para salir a venderla a diferentes  lugares y poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Lorenzo está muy contento de poder seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es poder comprarse otro carro para poder transportar su venta. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 61, lives with his wife and their four children in the rural community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. He makes a living selling firewood and corn. He gets up very early to go out and sell his products in the community.

Lorenzo also goes out to other nearby areas to sell. His customers are women who sell tortillas and also those who own small grocery stores so they can stock their businesses with corn.

Lorenzo is requesting a loan to buy firewood and corn so he has enough merchandise to sell to various places and to earn enough income to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Lorenzo is very happy to be working with Prisma. His dream is to buy another vehicle to transport his products.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn for his business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a former acrobat, dancer and tumbler who turned to yoga for healing and balance. Leticia, a yoga teacher, is the founder and owner of Lila Organics (www.lilaorganics.com), a home-grown clothing company rooted in the rhythms of Buenos Aires, Argentina, and now based in the adopted home of Washington, D.C.

What she has come to understand through friends and fellow yogis is the importance of being comfortable to express ourselves - yet look good - while being aware of the impact that our interactions have on the environment. Lila Organics styles are created to feel and look good on any body type, and to be worn to yoga or anywhere you would like. All Lila Organics clothing is made from the finest organic materials, including wild-harvested, organic and fair-trade certified bamboo, soy, hemp and cotton. Lila Organics clothing is made locally at its own production factory.

loans.use: to increase her product offering, increasing her inventory in terms of variety and quantity.

loans.name: Olger

texts.es: Olger tiene la edad de 50 años, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  sembrar 2000 matas de chile.  Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Los productos de su finca los vende en una feria del agricultor directamente al cliente. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Olger is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children who are his main priority. He wants to plant 2,000 chile plants.  Olger has dedicated various years to his farm and he wants to expand it and also, he wants his farm to be very productive. Olger sells the produce from his farm at an agricultural fair directly to the customer.

This is Olger's 1st loan through FUDECOSUR. Although he has not taken out other loans from state banks or cooperatives, FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with major facilities and a much lower interest rate. 

Olger also wants to provide his children the education necessary to become well prepared persons who can confront life in the future with greater ease.

loans.use: to plant a crop of chiles.

loans.name: Inés Colombia

texts.es: Inés es una señora emprendedora de 54 años de edad, 20 de ellos los ha dedicado a trabajar en su negocio, una floristería que inició para aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presentaba, pues vio que en su municipio no existía un establecimiento que ofreciera el servicio y por lo tanto era una buena plaza para poner en marcha su proyecto. El negocio está ubicado en el garaje de su casa y desde allí trabaja sola todos los días, situación que la favorece ya que su movilidad es reducida por un problema físico que no le permite desplazarse bien, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica familiar. Su empuje, dedicación y espíritu de liderazgo le han permitido ser reconocida en el sector y ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades que se le presentan. Actualmente solicita su tercer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en el pago de facturas a proveedores y para comprar materia prima (flores, cintas, espuma floral, bases, entre otros), de esta manera tendrá disponibilidad de inventario suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de las temporadas especiales y además podrá equilibrar sus finanzas para que el negocio se sostenga en los meses que las ventas estén bajas. Inés desea seguir trabajando en su negocio para que se pueda sostener en el tiempo y le genere los recursos económicos que necesita para aportar a la economía familiar, pues su principal objetivo es hacer de su negocio una fuente de ingresos rentable aún en los tiempos difíciles y poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Inés is an enterprising woman, 54 years old; 20 of them have been devoted to working at her business, a florist shop that she started in order to take advantage of the opportunity that was presenting itself. She saw that in her municipality no establishment existed that provided the service, and therefore there was a good opening to get her project going.

The business is located in the garage of her home, and from there she works on her own every day, a situation that benefits her as her mobility is reduced due to a physical problem that doesn't allow her to get around well. This way she generates enough resources to help her husband with the family's financial burdens. 

Her drive, dedication and leadership spirit have allowed her to become well known in the area, and she has managed to succeed in spite of the challenges that arise. 

Currently she is requesting her third loan so that she can use it to pay supplier invoices and to buy raw materials (flowers, ribbons, floral foam, bases and other items). In this way she will have sufficient inventory available to meet the demand at special seasons, and also be able to balance her finances so that the business can be sustained in the months that sales are low. 

Inés wishes to keep working in her business so that it can sustain itself over time and generate the resources she needs to contribute to the family finances. Her main objective is to make her business a profitable source of income, even in the difficult times, and little by little improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay supplier invoices and to buy raw materials (flowers, ribbons, floral foam, bases and other items).

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia works hard to support her family. Venancia is married and has a fish dealer business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Venancia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Venancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: José Cristian

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado y es una persona casada, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su matrimonio han procreado 4 hijos. 
 José se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que van a la escuela,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza. Se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres;  para llegar a la parcelas camina 3 kilómetros y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a cuidar una finca como vigilante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera y producir mas leche para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia

José planea construir una vivienda, para su familia ya que actualmente donde viven se filtra el agua en invierno y no es muy segura
texts.en:
José is 28 years old, has a ninth grade education, has a stay-at-home wife, and together they have four children. His wife and children, who are enrolled in school, all depend on his work.

He gets up everyday at 4:00 a.m. and works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. He walks three kilometers to his plot and works all morning while his wife milks the cows and sells the milk. Later, during the afternoon, he works as a caretaker on a farm.

The loan José is requesting will be used to purchase a dairy cow and produce more milk for retail sale. In this way he will earn more income with which to take care of his family. 

José is also planning to build a home for his family, as where they currently live develops leaks in the winter and is not very safe.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su negocio el cual es una pulpería que tiene desde hace más de 7  años.
Doña Juana tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de productos como azúcar, arroz, café, pan, churros, aguas, manteca, etc. y poder así seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Juana espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Juana espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para  que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard-working, modest and responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family. She sells basic household items in her business, which is a small general store that she has had for more than seven years. 

Juana has her business in her home and needs the loan to buy a great variety of items such as sugar, rice, coffee, bread, snacks, bottled water, lard, etc. and to be able to continue doing her work. 

Juana expects her sales to increase and that this loan will be a big help to her.  This is because she does not have the products that her customers now demand and place orders for.  Thanks to this she hopes to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  In the short term Juana hopes to make her business grow, enabling her to continue supporting her family so that they can have greater opportunities in life. 


Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, coffee, bread, snacks, bottled water, lard, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gombotseren

texts.en: Gombotseren, 55 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a passenger transportation business since 2004 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife helps him by working as conductor. Their daughter studies at college and is now a third-year student. Using his previous loan, he managed to build his own house and now his family lives in a comfortable and warm place. This time he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy furniture such as closets, drawers and a sofa. This will make his house a more comfortable place for living and give him more enthusiasm to work harder. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43-years-old and married with two children who are in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and 46-years-old with two children, one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a bakery business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase equipment and ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, milk, etc.

Emma has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, milk, etc.

loans.name: Epegenia

texts.en:
Epegenia is 42 years old and has three children, who are in school.  Epegenia works very hard to provide for them.

Epegenia runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.  She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Epegenia would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 31 years old and married with one child in school.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school; Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Mila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Delgermaa, 34 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a beautician at beauty salon since 2003. Her son is eight years old and goes to elementary school. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase a fridge, sofa, and clothes cupboard. She wants to improve her living conditions by decorating her house with some of the furniture. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a future.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Noel es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la Soldadura y tiene un negocio el cual es un Taller de balconearía y soldadura desde hace más de 7 años.
Don Noel su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en la colonia donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de materiales como hierro, soplete, prensas, una escuadra, etc. y poder así seguir realizando su trabajo.
Don Noel con el préstamo espera que sus trabajos aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los materiales que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados y a la vez gracias a la inversión espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la  de su familia. 
Espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Señor Noel is a very hard-working person, humble and responsible. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras with his family.  He works in welding and has had a business, a balcony and welding shop, for more than 7 years.

Don Noel's business is located in his home in the town where he lives. He needs the loan for the purchase of a great variety of materials, such as iron, a blowtorch, clamps, a square, etc., and to thus be able to continue doing his work.

Don Noel hopes that with the loan his work will grow, and that this will help him a lot, since now he doesn't have the materials required for the orders that his customers have placed. At the same time, thanks to the investment, he hopes to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family a bit. In the short term, he hopes to increase his business and with this to be able to continue supporting his family so that they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September  2013

loans.use: to buy iron, a blowtorch, clamps, a square, etc., for his business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from making dried fish.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rose has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fish vending.  

Natividad is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase items such as rice, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchased items, such as rice, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ankhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ankhbaatar, who is 42 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been rendering passenger transportation service to local people using his minivan since 2010. His wife helps him by working as the conductor. Their children both go to high school. 

Using his previous loan, he had repaired his house roof. This time he is requesting a loan of MNT 3,200,000 to buy necessary spare parts for his old minivan. After repairing his minivan, he can continue to run his transportation business, which is the only income source for whole family. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who repaid his previous loans without any delay on the scheduled dates.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his minivan

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell in her egg business.

Wilma has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling rice.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 49 years old and married, with six children, three of whom are in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay her laborers' salaries and purchase more stocks to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pays her laborers' salaries and purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Anibel

texts.en:
Anibel works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Anibel has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Anibel has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Perpetuo Socorro es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Ita, donde todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que por medio de esto puedan conocer la situación de cada una y unir esfuerzos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Albina se dedica a la venta de Frutas y cometa que por medio de su trabajo ella ayuda y aporta a la casa, dando a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella con la capacitación de Plan de Negocios sobre Venta de Comidas también está incursionando en esta venta.
La Sra. Albina Solicita  este crédito para la compra de Frutas y verduras, también la compra de materias primas para su negocio de Venta de Comidas; lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
En la foto aparecen 23 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene ese numero de integrantes, pero en este ciclo una de ellas no retira el crédito, pero firma de igual manera.
texts.en:
"Perpetua Socorro" is the name of this communal bank, which was formed in the city of Ita.  All of the members are taking the poverty elimination survey, so that each one's situation will be understood, and the group can join forces.  

One of the members is Albina, who has a business selling fruit.  She comments that through her work, she helps and contributes to the household and provides for her family's daily needs.  

Having completed business plan training pertaining to food sales, Albina is also going to start up a business selling food.  Albina is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, and also to buy supplies for her food sales business.  This will help her to carry out her business plan, which will enable her to increase her income. 

In the photo 23 women appear, because this group has this many members.  In this loan cycle some of them will not be participating in the loan, but will co-sign anyway.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell, and also ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel, who is 25 years old, lives with her husband, sister-in-law, and brother-in-law in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a saleswoman at a store for seven months. Her husband works as a sales manager at a private firm. Her brother-in-law has a position as a machinist at a power station. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 5,500,000 to buy an electric car. 

The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. So buying this car is beneficial to air-pollution-intense Ulaanbaatar as well as to the borrower for transportation.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Genny Mae

texts.en:
Genny Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her parents are both private employees but having six siblings, their income is not good enough to support all their family's needs. 

This semester, Genny Mae needs help financially to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. To cover the costs, she has borrowed PHP 10,000  from GDMPC micro-credit, which she had joined recently. 

Her ambition is to finish her studies.  She wants to help her parents and the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Manith Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Manith se dedica al comercio y su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, que es venta de ropa América clasificada, lo tiene desde hace 2 años su negocio se encuentra en el área comercial de su comunidad donde el tránsito de personas a diario es alto y su clientela aumenta con el paso de los días.
Doña Manith su negocio tiene variedad de producto para jóvenes y adultos de todas las edades, también vende piñatas, elabora manualidad y vende otros producto los cuales llaman la atención de sus clientes por los precio y por la calidad.
Doña Manith solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de unos fardos de pantalones juveniles, ya que estos han traído mucha demanda en la actualidad y le gustaría tener este producto a la venta en su negocio. sueña con tener una tienda mas amplia y un local propio porque en el que esta actualmente es alquilado.



Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Manith is a merchant, and her business is her main source of income.  She's had a business selling American clothing for 2 years.  Her store is located in a commercial area in her community where a lot of people pass through each day.  Over time she is gaining more and more customers.

Manith sells a variety of products for youths and adults of all ages.  She also sells piñatas, makes handicrafts, and sells other products which her customers notice because of the quality and prices.

Manith is requesting the support of a loan to buy some bales of pants for young people, because there is a lot of demand for these right now, and she would like to have this product to sell in her business.  Manith dreams of having a bigger store and her own space, because the space she is in right now is rented. 

Danlí, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy pants for her business

loans.name: Arodgina

texts.en:
Arodgina is 37 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arodgina has a business buying and selling wood in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell.

Arodgina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elena is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elena has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia la Matriz tiene dos hijos Mauricio de 7 y Damaris de 1 año de edad, vive en casa de familiares desde hace 6 años atrás , con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios. El mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido que el padre de sus hijo no está con ellos, pese a esto  Lorena no ha escatimado en sacrificarse y dedicarse en un 100% a sus hijos y a darles lo mejor que en sus posibilidades está, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y cosméticos, esto ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Tiene ingresos adicionales ya que el padre de sus hijos le da una pequeña pensión para la manutención de los pequeños. Lorena es una joven trabajadora, emprendedora y muy responsable por la crianza y educación de sus hijos, por eso Lorena nunca se da por vencida y busca la manera de subsistir.
Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado con su madre quien se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida típica, en su negocio dedica toda la tarde para vender sus productos, visitar clientes y hacer gestión de cobranza y en la mañana cuida de su hija pequeña y atiende su hogar realizando varios quehaceres domésticos. Lorena  se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que la aprendió de su cuñada quien le brindó todo su apoyo desde el inicio, y desde ahí  ha tenido  gran acogida con sus productos, tiene clientes potenciales en las instituciones públicas y privadas de la ciudad, es muy reconocida por su carisma y amabilidad para comercializar sus productos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería variada que pueda mantener en stock para ofrecer a sus clientes por temporada navideña en la cual las ventas son muy buenas y con gran acogida por las promociones que hay. Esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y utilidad.
Lorena quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Lorena, who is 27 years old, is a single mother. She was born in the city of Latacunga, in La Matriz parish. She has two children, Mauricio, age 7, and Damaris, age 1. She has lived with relatives for 6 years. Through the sacrifice of her parents, she was able to finish her secondary school studies. The greatest obstacle in her life has been that the father of her children is not with them. In spite of this, Lorena has not skimped on sacrificing and dedicating herself 100% to her children and giving them the best that she is capable of. She sells clothing, perfumes, and cosmetics. This has allowed her to raise her children. She has additional income, since the father of her children gives her a small allowance for the support of the little ones. Lorena is a hard-working young woman, entrepreneurial and very responsible for raising and educating her children. For this reason, Lorena never gives up and looks for the way to persist.

Since she was very young, she has worked with her mother, who prepares and sells typical food. In her business, she works all afternoon to sell her products, visit customers, and carry out collection activities. In the morning, she cares for her little daughter and tends to her home, doing various domestic chores. Lorena buys and sells beauty products by catalog, a business that she learned from her sister-in-law, who offered her all her support from the beginning, and since then she has had a great response to her products. She has prospective customers in the public and private institutions of the city, and she is very well known for her charisma and friendliness in selling her products. The loan that she is applying for is to purchase merchandise that she can keep in stock to offer her customers for the Christmas season, when the sales are very good, with great response to the promotions that are offered. This will help her to improve her income and profits. 

Lorena wants to extend sincere appreciation and greetings to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth of her working and personal life.

loans.use: to buy products to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
With two new members, the Mertha Sedana group is continuing its loan. In addition to developing their business of buying piglets, ther loan was also used to buy pig food and fix the cages. From the previous loan, the group can save for venture capital. The new loan will be used to develop their business. All members of the group feel these loans are very helpful because they can develop business and generate revenues to improve the welfare of their families.

Ni Ketut woud buy two super-quality piglets and feed. She plans to keep pigs for fattening. 

Ni Ketut thanks MUK, KIVA and lenders for their support to help her to develop the business and improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To buy two super-quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Gladis Ubel

texts.es:
La señora Gladis  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus hijos y su esposo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una  chiclera y venta  de  cosméticos  desde hace más de 10  años.
Doña Gladis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  cremas,  talcos,  lociones, confites, bombones, galletas, chocolates y churros para sus negocios y con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes y por ende poder atenderlos mejor.
Doña Gladis espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más  grandes y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Septiembre  del   2013
texts.en:
Gladis  is a responsible, hard working and honest person. She lives with her children and husband in southern Honduras. 

For the past ten years she has run a business selling candy and cosmetics. 

Gladis is requesting a loan to buy creams, powders, lotions, candy, chocolates, cookies and churros for her business. 

With the loan she hopes her sales will increase since she will have more products to offer her clients and in this way serve them better. 

Gladis hopes to cover the necessities she has and improve the quality of life of her family a little. 

In a few years she hopes that her business keeps growing and that it turns into one of the biggest and most famous in the area and that her children turn into good people with more opportunities in society. 


Choluteca, Honduras  – September 2013

loans.use: to buy creams, powders, lotions, candy, chocolates, cookies and churros for her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married, with one young child. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like sugar, edible oil, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, and soap. Her business started one year ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy various supplies, like eggs, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries, to attract more customers at the same time and maintain the inventory of her store.   

In the future, Jenelyn would like to expand her business and increase her business profitability for her child’s education and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various supplies, like eggs, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like chips, bread, spices, egg noodles, etc. for her general store business. Lilybeth has been in this business for 10 years. Lilybeth earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Lilybeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like chips, bread, spices, egg noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ell Freeborge

texts.en: Ell Freeborge is a 21 year old studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Misamis University in Oroquieta City. He is in third year level in college. His father works as a mechanic while his mother is a private employee. Ell Freeborge helped his parents find ways to support his education. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester. He is hopeful to finish his study and be able to find a job that fits his qualifications in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna’s interest in fitness began when she first joined a kickboxing club. After working out there for several years and later becoming a certified instructor, it was a natural progression for Joanna to open her own franchise.

The statewide kickboxing club is a cardio-intensive total body workout that began in the 1990s in Hoboken, New Jersey. Joanna believes in the exercise program, and she wants to help others achieve self-confidence and strength. Recently, Joanna hosted an outdoor kickboxing workout, which was a great success and brought about 30-35 attendees.

Since April 2013, Joanna has managed a full-time administration job in New York, in addition to owning this business franchise. A trained Zumba instructor and AFAA-certified group fitness instructor, Joanna is now pursuing another certification on obesity and exercise. 

Eventually, Joanna would like to be able to dedicate herself full-time to her franchise and to open additional franchises as well. The funds of this loan will go toward facility and labor expenses associated with running this new business.

loans.use: to pay for facility and labor expenses for her fitness club.

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is a 36-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She is into multiple businesses, like raising cattle and hogs and farming, to earn a living to help her husband, who is a carpenter. 

Ma. Merlinda needs additional capital to sustain her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed for her hogs and piglets to raise. 

With the additional capital, she will be able to support her household's needs like food and electricity.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a 50-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is into farming. She grows and sells rice to augment the income of their household. Her business started five years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay a laborer’s fee, so she can have a bountiful harvest to be able to meet the family's daily expenses.

 In the future, Leoncia hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for the family's sustainability of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es:
El Joven Carlos, de 32  años vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de  Nacaome, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08  años a la venta de ropa como ser pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa de niño, vestidos, capris, pantalones  de hombre y de mujer.
Carlos sus clientes son personas que le visitan el su negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome. 
Carlos está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de ropa como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, blusas y calzonetas ya que quiere seguir trabajando y crecer más en su  negocio, su sueño comprarse un carro para poder transportar su mercadería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, lives in his house located in the neighborhood of  Nacaome, Valle in the southern part of Honduras. 

For the past 8 years he has sold clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, children's clothes, capris and pants for men and women. 

His clients are people who come to his business located in the market located in the Nacoeme municipality. 

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and bathing suits since he wants to keep working and growing his business. His dream is to buy a car so he can transport his merchandise. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and bathing suits for his business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buying and selling vegetables business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school. Anita works very hard to provide for her children.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc. Anita has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gloria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, chicken, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La  señora Reina  de  42 años vive  en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa. 
Doña Reina quiere invertir más en su negocio para así poder tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de ropa como pantalones, faldas, camisas, trajes de niño, camisetas de tela y pantalones, capris, sandalias, zapatos de niño, vestidos, etc. 
Doña Reina tiene varios pedidos que le han hecho y necesita tener la mercadería para poder entregarlo a tiempo y así poder seguir aumentando más su negocio.
Su sueño mejorar mas su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Reina is 42 years old. She lives in her house in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. She has worked selling clothes for several years. Reina wants to invest more in her business so she can have more products to offer her customers. She is asking for the loan to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, children's suits, and t-shirts and pants, capris, sandals, children's shoes, dresses, etc. 
 
Reina has several orders and she needs to have merchandise to be abel to deliver on time and keep growing her business. Her dream is to improve her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, children's suits, t-shirts and pants, capris, sandals, children's shoes, dresses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been working in fishing business along with her husband for more than 8 years now. She is also engaged in seaweed farming. This is the source of their income.

Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the school fees of her children. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market and improve their seaweed farming as well. In the future, Gonzala hopes to expand their ventures so that they will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a 44-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel in Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 21, 19 and 17. She engages in selling kitchen wares and other dry goods. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy 10 dozen pairs of pants, 5 dozen pairs of shorts and 5 dozen t-shirts to maintain the inventory of her store. It could attract more customers as well.
   
In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of pants, 5 dozen pairs of shorts and 5 dozen t-shirts.

loans.name: Alfredo Valentin

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja como obrero de un fundo agrícola y con los ingresos de su trabajo puede salir adelante, Alfredo cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrado.

Alfredo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para construir la parte posterior de su casa para poder dar mayor seguridad a la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera dar mayor tranquilidad a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 24 years old. He works as a laborer on an agricultural estate, and with the income from his work he is able to get ahead. Alfredo believes that his work is going well for him because he is responsible and honest.

Alfredo is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy materials to build the rear part of his house in order to give better security to the home where he lives and in this way give greater peace of mind to his family and continue striving to make a reality of his great dream: to study to be a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es:
Oscar de 35 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo sus padres le pudieron dar el estudio hasta un bachillerato técnico, luego tubo que trabajar ya por su cuenta, trabajando la agricultura y otras actividades jornales que le ayudaran a ingresar dinero a su familia. Su esposa, tiene una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, con los que le ayuda a los gastos en la familia. Sus dos hijos están estudiando uno primaria y el otro octavo grado.

Oscar posee una pequeña joyería, en compañía de un familiar en la ciudad con mucho esfuerzo y mucha perseverancia la pudo fundar. Esta actividad la aprendió hace como 10 años, le enseño un amigo quien se dedicaba a esta actividad, tubo que pagar para aprender esta profesión. Ademas, cuando tiene poco trabajo se dedica a trabajar como albañil, ya que su padre  le enseño esta actividad, y los fines de semana es cobrador de un autobús que transita en las comunidades cercanas, donde vive. Todos los días, se dirige muy temprano a su pequeño taller en la ciudad a 4 kilómetros de su casa y llega por las tardes, cuando tiene mucho trabajo lo lleva para su casa y tiene que desvelarse toda la noche, para salir con el tiempo con los pedidos que le solicitan. 

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para construir las paredes a la champa donde a instalado la tienda de su esposa.  Actualmente, ella solo saca una parte de la mercadería y la otra la deja al interior de la casa, por que es muy pequeño el espacio en donde esta ubicada la tienda. 

Él espera para el futuro,  expandirse en su pequeño taller de joyería, instalar otro taller en diferente lugar para ayudar con mejores ingresos a su familia, y espera darles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is 35 years old. With much effort, his parents were able to give him an education with a technical degree. Later he had to work on his own i agriculture and other daily activities that helped him bring in income for his family. His wife has a small store in their house and with it she helps pay for the family expenses. His two children are in primary school and another is in eighth grade. 

Oscar has a little jewelry store with a relative in the city. With a lot of hard work and perseverance, he was able to open it. He learned this activity about 10 years ago. A friend who did this activity taught him and he had to pay to learn the profession. In addition, when he has little work he works as a bricklayer, since his father taught him that activity. Weekends he is a collector for a bus that goes through the communities close to where he lives. Every day he goes out very early to his little workshop in the city 4 kilometers from his house and he comes back in the afternoon. When he has a lot of work he takes it home and has to stay up all night so he can get out on time with the orders.  

The money from the loan will be used to t build walls on his wife's store. Right now, she just takes out some of the merchandise and leaves the rest inside the house because he space where she has the store is very small. 

He hopes that in the future he can expand his little jewelry store, setting up another store somewhere else to help with the family income. He hopes to give his children an education, if possible, a college education.

loans.use: to build walls where his wife has set up her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for coffee pickers

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Joan has been in this business for 17 years. Joan earns extra income from videoke, a rental karaoke machine.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma Judith es casada. Cuenta con 35 años de edad. De escolaridad 6to. Primaria. tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Ella se dedica a la fabricacion de Jabon Negro, tambien conocido como Jabon de coche(esto se utiliza para bañarse). Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de los jabones. Desea en el futuro ampliar su capital de trabajo y que su fabrica crezca y distribuir por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a al comercio y a elaboracion de Jabon Negro.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Judith is married. She is 35 years old. In school, she completed sixth grade. She has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She works making black soap, also known as car soap (this is used for bathing). She began this business with a little capital that she had saved up, and up to now she has 5 years of experience. She has the support of her husband.

She organized a group and is applying for a loan that will be used for the purchase of raw materials to make the soaps. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital, have her production grow, and sell wholesale.

The other members of the group work in business and in making black soap.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

Nena has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Roneta

texts.en:
Roneta is married with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roneta is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Roneta has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Roneta requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Roneta has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Roneta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Adela requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing boat motor for her business.

Adela has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat motor for her business

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty Group

texts.es:
Caaguazu Poty es un grupo muy trabajador, se formaron como propósito el crecimiento de cada una de las integrantes, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien tiene un kiosco y también vende comidas. Es un ejemplo esta señora debido al esfuerzo que hace, no solo para tener más ingresos, sino también para poder crecer en las capacitaciones que recibe.
Las señoras de este grupo además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer cómo se encuentra cada una en sus economías, y conforme eso trabajar.
Silvia por su parte pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su kiosco, como ser comestibles, golosinas, bebidas y demás, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar y también por superar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Caaguazu Poty is a group of hardworking women that was founded to facilitate the financial and personal growth of each one of its members.  Silvia is a member of this group.  She has a shop where she sells food.  She is an example to those around her because of the effort that she puts into her work not only to obtain more income but also to use what she gets to grow.

In addition, the women in this group are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey, which aims to understand the economic standing of the group members and find ways to improve.

Silvia is asking for a loan so she can invest in buying supplies for her shop such as food, sweets, drinks, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to continue working towards overcoming her poverty.

loans.use: buy food, drinks, and other things.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian home) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Tungalag and her husband, Chuluunbaatar, are starting their own animal pelt retail business. Her daughter, Anujin, studies at a local school. Tungalag and her husband have been working locally for years, since 2001, and have a lot of experience. They collect animal pelts from herders and sell to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city. They act as middlemen and make a profit out of it. Tungalag is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelt from herders in countryside and sell it to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelt from herders in the countryside and sell it to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.name: José Concepción

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, cuando era un niño su padre lo abandono, su madre solo pasaba trabajando en el campo, para conseguir el sustento diario, y nunca se preocupo de mandarlo a la escuela. Por esa razón, no sabe leer ni escribir, desde muy chico aprendió el oficio de agricultor y cría de ganado, todos los años siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y tiene varias reses, también trabaja como vigilante en una hacienda.

Para comprar sus reses, don José, tiene que pedir permiso en su trabajo, para ir hasta el tiangue, ya que ahí puede seleccionar animales de mejor calidad; para ello aborda un camión en su comunidad, ahí viaja por 45 minutos hasta llegar, luego de comprar, carga los animales en el camión y regresa a casa.

Don José, solicita $1,600.00, para comprar 3 novillas próximas a parir, para obtener leche para la alimentación de su familia y venderle a sus vecinos.

Si compra sus novillas, don José, podrá tener un ingreso extra, así podrá satisfacer otras necesidades de su familia   

La vida de don José, podrá  cambiar con este préstamo, porque incrementara el numero de reses y obtendrá leche para mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.   

Don José, sueña con tener unas 5 vacas de raza lechera.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, is married, and has 3 children.  When he was young, his father abandoned him, leaving his mother to work in the fields in order to support her family.  She wasn't ever able to send him to school.  For this reason, he doesn't know how to read or write.  When he was very young, he learned how to farm and raise cows.  Every year, he plants 14,000 square meters of corn and he also has many cows.  In addition, he works as a security guard at a ranch.

To buy his cows, José has to ask permission to leave work and go to the market where he selects the best quality cows.  To do so, he gets on a truck in his town and drives 45 minutes to get there.  Once there, he buys the cows he wants, loads them in the truck, and returns home.

José is asking for $1,600 to buy 3 heifers close to giving birth so he can obtain milk to feed his family and also sell to his neighbors.  If he can buy these heifers, José will be able to have some extra income and in this way meet the needs of his family.

José's life will be improved by this loan because it will increase the number of cows that he has and allow him to obtain milk to increase his income and the quality of life of his family.

José hopes to have 5 milk cows.

loans.use: buy 3 heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to help him with his studying.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael está casado con la señora Edith, tienen 5 hijos, 3 de ellos en edad escolar, viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá, allí surten a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como bebidas varias, lácteos, carne, panificados, carbón, verduras y otros.
El y su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras, y con su esfuerzo están criando a sus hijos, ya que quieren darles un buen futuro, una buena educación, y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien. Este crédito lo pide para la compra de carne, panificados, carbón, verduras y otros.
Cuenta el Sr. Rafael que además él trabaja como empleado de una empresa como jefe de seguridad hace más de 3 años. El señor Rafael es una persona muy responsable y con muchas ganas de mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia, mientras él está trabajando como empleado su esposa junto con sus hijos se encargar de administrar el negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael is married to Edith; they have 5 children, 3 of whom are school-age. They live in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Itá. There, they supply their neighbors and occasional customers with all kinds of basic household goods, like various drinks, dairy products, meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items. 

He and his wife are very hardworking people, and through their efforts they are raising their children, because they want to give them a good future, a good education, and for them to be good people. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items.

Rafael says that additionally, he has worked as a business employee as the head of security for more than 3 years. Rafael is a very responsible person who has a great desire to improve his and his family’s standard of living. While he works as an employee, his wife, together with their children, are in charge of running the business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Imelda is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nylon, etc., for her seaweed-culture business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nylon, etc., for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her seaweed-culture business.

Amie has been in this business for seven years. Amie earns more income from food vending, fishing and raising pigs.

Amie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  Joven Gloria de 20 años de edad,  vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una colonia de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 al destaza de cerdos y lo realiza todos los días de la semana.
Gloria compra los cerdos por semana para así tenerlos y destazarlos para luego salir a vender la carne en los diferentes barrios y colonias.
Gloria está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas cerdos y cabros en donde quiere incrementar mas su negocio ya que así pueda destazar dos cerdos y un cabro por día, nunca ha tenido créditos con ninguna institución.
Su sueño es poder comprar cerdos   incrementar mas su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013
texts.en: Gloria is 20 years old and lives in her house which is located a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For the last six years, she has worked as a pig butcher, and she works seven days a week. Gloria buys the pigs every week so that she can carve them into cuts of meat to sell in different local areas. Gloria is requesting the loan to buy more pigs and goats so that her business can grow and she can carve two pigs and one goat daily. She has not received loans before from any institution. Her dream is to be able to buy more pigs and to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy pigs and goats for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosario is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosario has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for 24 years. Teresita earns more income from pre-paid mobile load credits.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, spices, etc., for her food-vending business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalina earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is a 22-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two young children, ages 2 years old and 9 months old, respectively. Her husband works as a security guard to support their family. She is also engaged in farming. Her business started two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and medicines to yield more harvest. 

In the future, Maria Flor would like  to expand her business and increase the business profitability for her children’s welfare, including good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and medicines.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycad (pedicab) transportation. Vilma is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, rice, etc., for her food-vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a tricycad (pedicab) transportation business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her tricycad business.

Vilma has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her tricycad (pedicab) business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 47 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Gertrudes has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 53 years old and is married with four children. He resides in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, along with his family. His wife is a fish vendor, while he manages their own farm to earn a living. He used to grow and harvest coconuts to sell in town and also planted bananas for sale. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. Recently, his farm is in need of fertilization to have a greener and abundant harvest. His income before was used in their daily living and school fees, so he borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer. His future plan is to buy another farm to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita works hard to support her family. Alita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Alita has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Alita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motor cycle

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Antonio, tiene 51 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, desde que tenia 11 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura, aprendió con un tío que lo crío, ya que sus papas no se ocuparon de él, Nunca asistió a la escuela por dedicarse al trabajo para lograr subsistir, actualmente siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, el cual vende en elote, este lo produce con sistema de riego, para lograr 4 cosechas en el año, para efectuar los riegos tiene que ubicar la tubería surco por surco y un riego de 7,000 metros cuadrados lo hace en dos días de trabajo.  

Don Antonio, para comprar sus insumos, aborda un autobús en su comunidad, viaja unos 30 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad.

Don Antonio, solicita $500.00, para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante y otros productos para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego. De esta manera,  podrá comprar sus insumos de un solo viaje, esto le ahorrara tiempo y dinero, ya que le darán precio mas bajo. 

Al tener todos sus insumos en casa, don Antonio, podrá dar un manejo oportuno a su cultivo, esto hará que su cosecha sea mas abundante, y también sus ingresos, así podrá pagar su crédito a tiempo y tendrá comida para su familia   

Don Antonio, sueña con tener unas 3 vacas de raza lechera, para tener un ingreso adicional y alimento para su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has worked in farming since he was 11 years old. He learned the trade from his uncle who raised him because his parents did not take care of him. He never went to school as he needed to work to survive. He currently sows 14,000m2 of corn, and he sells the cobs. The corn is produced using an irrigation system in order to obtain four harvests per year.  To carry out the irrigation, he has to install the pipes in every single furrow and to water a 7000m2 area takes two days. To buy his supplies, Antonio takes the local bus to the city, 30 minutes ride away. He is requesting $500 to buy six bags of fertilizer and other supplies to sow 10,500m2 of corn. With the money from the loan, he will only need to make one trip to buy the supplies, and this will save him time and money as they will charge him less for buying in bulk. Once he has all the supplies, Antonio will be able to take better care of his crops and obtain a more abundant harvest. His income will increase allowing him to pay back the loan and put food on the table for his family. Antonio dreams of having three dairy cows to have an extra source of income and food for his family.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and other supplies to sow a 10,500m2 area of corn on irrigated land.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is 43 years old and married with three children. He lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting mangos to earn a living. His business has been successful and he was able to successfully repay his previous loan and also buy a motor cab with his profits. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and recently, he requested a new loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for his motor cab maintenance. He is hopeful to earn more profit so his business will be successful. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for his motor cab maintenance

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.en:
Cholpon is a student of the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), department of European Studies and here is her story:
“One of my main goals is to explore Europe. I am interested in European history, history of European culture, European literature, and multicultural European society, the rights of the European Union and European languages. I am very interested in European Studies, both on a national and international level, and am determined to promote positive change in my country and region.
