I am convinced that completion of my studies at the American University of Central Asia will provide me with the capacity to do so. 
AUCA provides the best quality education among Central Asian universities with two diplomas, both Kyrgyz state and Bard college diplomas. Another important point is that I have a high regard for AUCA's liberal arts program as every course is worthy of a bachelor degree. The academic environment at AUCA is welcoming and has responsive instructors who are highly experienced. Studying in the Preparatory Program already gave me the chance to prepare myself for further study at AUCA by improving my English speaking and grammar and most importantly writing skills with the support of my instructors in the Preparatory Program. 
AUCA also provides students with the facilities required for learning and I am sure higher education at this unique university will lead me toward success and a bright future. As a result, according to my academic achievements, personal qualities and social work, I will be able to be a promising student of the AUCA. My previous academic achievements and active participation at my school’s extracurricular activities are examples of my interest in Europe.
Studying at the Preparatory Program made me more enthusiastic to study at AUCA and I know that AUCA is the right place for me.  I chose to study at AUCA in order to have a successful future not only for me and my family but also for my community and country. I am certain that through pursuing my career I can move towards the achievements of my long standing goals of my country’s political, social and economic improvement. And studying at the European Studies Department at AUCA will support me to reach my aims and ambitions. It will also provide the chance and prospect for the fulfillment of aspirations of a Kyrgyz girl who is looking ahead with immense sense of hope for a bright future to be part of the modernization and advancement of my beloved country.
But unfortunately my family is not able to afford the full tuition at AUCA. I need a KIVA loan to make sure that I will not have to struggle with the finance difficulties while pursuing my bachelor degree.”

loans.use: To help pay for my bachelor degree in European Studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the floor of her salon.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 51 year old woman from the town of San Miguel ,Bohol. She is married with 5 children. The oldest child is 27 while the youngest is 19. Her husband works as a mill operator to support their family. She works to make homemade meals like vegetables guisado, fish soup, and chicken and other meat recipes for customers. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and dried fish, to continue her business. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her food vending business and increase her business profitability for her children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and dried fish

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is running a general store in Oroquieta City while her husband is working as an OFW. She has been doing this for more than three years as an aid to her husband's income. In 2012, she joined GDMPC and recently, Rachel borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more grocery goods, rice and corn grits and feed to sell. Her future plan is to expand her business and use the profit for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, rice and corn grits and feed to sell

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alpha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods and farming sugarcane. Alpha is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and selling rice.

Alpha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Мухамади 30 лет, является семейным человеком и имеет одного двухлетнего ребенка. Мухамади занимается торговлей более 7 лет. Он имеет свой продуктовый магазин на рынке Гиссарского района, где в частности продает масла, сахар, чай, консервированные продукты, макароны и т.д., а также хозяйственные товары. Он надеется, что его магазин и дальше будет одним из самых востребованных. Для достижения своей цели он много трудился не покладая рук. Мухамади сейчас обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить новый ассортимент продуктов питания и хозяйственного товара для развития торговли. Он ждет поддержки, чтобы заполнить свой магазин товаром. Ему дорог этот магазин.
texts.en: Muhamadi is 30 years old. He is a family man and has one two hear old child. Muhamadi has been in sales for over seven years. He has own grocery store on the market of the Gissar region where he mainly sells butter, sugar, tea, canned products, pasta and other goods such as household products. He hopes that his store will be always in high demand. He worked a lot without rest to reach his goal. Muhamadi has now come to ask for a loan to buy a new variety of food products and household goods to grow sales. He is waiting for support so that he can fill his store with goods. His store is very dear to him.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of food and household merchandise to grow sales.

loans.name: Mahmadzarif

texts.ru: Махмадзариф 33-летний житель района Гиссар. Более 7 лет он занимается животноводством. Махмадзариф разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этот не легкий труд отнимает много времени и сил, но он не боится трудностей, потому что мотивацией для работы служат его жена и трехлетняя дочь, которых необходимо обеспечивать. Мухаммадзариф сейчас нуждается в кредите. Так как ему необходимо закупить пару молодых бычков для продолжения своей животноводческой деятельности. Помогите Махмадзарифу!
texts.en: Mahmadzarif is a 33 year old resident of the Gissar region. He has been doing animal husbandry for over seven years. Mahmadzarif breeds large horned cattle at home. It's not an easy job and takes a lot of time and strength, but he is not afraid of hardship because he is motivated by his wife and three year old daughter whom he has to support. Mahmadzarif needs a loan right now. He has to buy a couple of young calves  to continue his animal husbandry business. Please help Mahmadzarif!

loans.use: to purchase a couple of young calves to continue the animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Ochilboy

texts.ru: Очилбой родом из района Рудаки, ему 55 лет. В настоящий момент он разведен и живет один. У него есть двое детей, которые работают за границей. Очилбой имеет высшее образование. Однако он занимается другим делом. У Очилбоя собственный цветочный бизнес. Он уже 10 лет как в своем цветочном павильоне, расположенном в парке города, продает горшечные цветы и комнатные растения, в частности такие как катарантус, герань, фикус, алиандра, алоэ, фиалка, драцена, спатифиллум, циперус, шефлера и т.д. Его работа приносит ему самому не только доход и удовольствие, но и радость людям. Очилбой сейчас хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент горшечных цветов и комнатных растений.
texts.en: Ochilboy is from the Rudaki region, he is 55 years old. At this time he is divorced and lives alone. He has two children who are working abroad. Ochilboy has higher education, but is doing something else. He has his own flower business. He has been selling potted flowers and house plants such as katarantus, geral, ficus, oleander, aloe vera, violettes, dracena, spatifillum, ciperus and others for over ten years in his own flower shop located in the town's park. His work does not only bring him income and joy, but happiness to others. Ochilboy wants to grow his business. He is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment of potted flowers and house plants.

loans.use: to purchase potted flowers and house plants to grow his business.

loans.name: Shlair

texts.en:
Shlair is a professional hair dresser and beautician with 28 years of experience. She opened her business in 1986 in Iraq. At the time training institutions were only available in Baghdad where she completed her studies and since continued to participate in various trainings to stay up to date with new techniques. She understands the need and finds it important to provide her customers with the best services.

At work as a business woman she has been able to grow her business and employ 3 women; at home as a mother she been a role mother to her two daughters. Both of her daughters are following in her footsteps; one of them is currently working with her while the other has already been able to open her own salon with help from Shlair.   

As she explains with her own words in the video: “My name is Shlair, I am the owner of the salon. I have been working in this field for 28 years after attending some training courses in Baghdad at the Fluna Institute for Beauty. I also went to Jordan for attending an exhibition for Beauty Salon owners and I also worked in Turkey for a little while. I feel happy to work in this field, earn money for my daily life, and I’m proud to have two daughters who have already made their certifications as well. And I plan to expand this beauty shop.”  

She enjoys working with her customers and is happy for having been able to open and maintain a reputable salon. To ensure the salon continues to provide high level services, Shlair decided to take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $10,000. She would like to update the style of the salon, most importantly to buy new special chairs for both the hairdressing works and for the beautician’s corner. As she explains, the current chairs are very old, hard to work with and one of them is completely out of order with a broken system. She will also use the loan to purchase additional high quality cosmetics and supplies, and based on her customers' requests, she would also like to buy certain items for retail in the shop and this way help her customers gain access to products unavailable in other shops.  

After the upgrade of the salon is complete, Shlair’s long term goal is to establish her salon as a teaching institute for other aspiring women interested to work in the field.

loans.use: to update the style of the salon, most importantly buy new special chairs and equipment

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Experiencing first hand a community level problem effecting many families, Shireen turned a personal need into an enterprise.  

In 2003, working as a teacher herself, Shireen had work commitments until 5pm but was unable to find day care for her young child. The few government provided facilities were inadequate, crowded and would only be open until 1pm – leaving many families in deadlock when choosing between mothers working or staying at home.

With very little money, no support, and many challenges Shireen took matters into her own hands and decided to open a private kindergarten and day care center. While many people would not believe in her potential for success and commented the opening with sour words, she had proved them wrong. The small endeavor had since outgrown its original location and since 2009 operates from 3 small locations – one of which is shown on the pictures.

Shireen now has 10 years experience with managing kindergartens, and 19 years experience as a teacher. She is a mother of two children, but through her business takes care of 200 children with the help of 60 employees. As she explains in the video: “My name is Shireen, owner of this kindergarten which was established in 2003. I established the Kindergarten because when I had my baby I didn't find a place to put her in during my work as a teacher until 5:00 pm. It was the first private Kindergarten in the area. Now there are 60 women working in my Kindergartens and 5 drivers, we created jobs for 60 women. Now we have 200 kids. The Kindergarten work starts beginning of September 2013.”

Shireen works with a small profit margin to ensure her kindergarten’s services are affordable for working families. Continuing to provide services with a high level of attention to details Shireen is taking an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $25,000 which she will use to install a fire alarm system, fix water pipes, and renew some of the furnishing and carpeting as required by local regulations.

Shireen would one day like to also open an orphanage to provide care and education for children most in need.

loans.use: to install a fire alarm system in the kindergarten

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica, who is married with an only child, resides in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. While her husband is working as a private employee, she manages their farm to make a living. She also grows and harvests mango on her farm. Recently, she joined GDMPC and is borrowing 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She knows very well that with this investment, she will earn multiple returns. She plans to use her income to buy another farm and to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Maribec

texts.en:
Maribec is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from San Miguel, Bohol. She operates a retail store in her place in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Maribec sells various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Maribec is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Maribec wants to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Shuane

texts.en:
Shuane works hard to support her family. Shuane is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Shuane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, paint, etc.

Shuane has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Shuane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, paint, etc

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. Leonora earns more income from raising livestock.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis is married with an only child. He runs a general store while his wife works in a private company to make a living. He has been doing this business for more two years. His customers' demands for more items they want to buy in his store encouraged him to add to his capital. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, bottled products and biscuits for sale. He plans to use his profit to purchase more products for the satisfaction of his clients. In the future, he want to expand his business to have better income for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, bottled products and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед молодой начинающий предприниматель из района Хамадони. Ему 27 лет. Он усвоил технологию производства по переработке хлопка и теперь в своем районе хочет открыть собственный цех по переработке хлопка. Данный бизнес очень прибыльный. Джамшед будет закупать хлопок от своих односельчан. Он уже приобрел помещение для цеха. Джамшед просит кредит, чтобы купить оборудования. Ему не хватает собственных средств для реализации покупки, потому что такая техника стоит очень дорого. Джамшед старается преуспеть и найти источник дохода. Ведь он недавно женился и ждет появления ребенка. По этой причине он неустанно продвигается вперед, чтобы в будущем преуспеть в бизнесе и его семья жила в хороших условиях. Он надеется на поддержку!
texts.en: Jamshed is a young, first-time entrepreneur from the Hamadoni district. He is 27 years old. He has learned the manufacturing technique for processing cotton and now he wants to open his own processing facility for processing cotton in his district. This business is very profitable. Jamshed will buy the cotton from his fellow villagers. He has already bought the space for the facility. Jamshed is requesting a loan to buy equipment. He does not have enough personal savings to make this purchase as this kind of technology is very expensive. Jamshed is trying his best to succeed and find a source of income. This is compounded by the fact that he was recently married and is expecting a baby. For this reason he tirelessly forges ahead so that, in the future, he will be successful in business and his family will have good living conditions. He relies on your support!

loans.use: to purchase equipment for cotton processing in order to open a production facility.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Connie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as sardines, juice, noodles, etc. to sell.

Connie has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Connie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as sardines, juice, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetable to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to have enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is running her retail store located in Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. Her husband works as a private driver while she manages her fruit stand to make a living. She has been in this business for more than three years. In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC and, recently, Natividad borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more variety of fruits to resell. Her profits from the business will be used to expand her fruit stand.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Elyor

texts.ru: Элёр позитивный и дружелюбный мужчина. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Элёр в своё время смог получить среднее образование. Сейчас он работает плотником. Он занимается построением и ремонтом жилищных помещений частных лиц, и от этого получает приемлемый доход. С недавних пор Элёр отделился от своих родителей и живёт со своей семьёй в своём доме. Он недавно построил себе дом. В данный момент Элёр начал бизнес животноводства, чтобы иметь дополнительный хороший заработок, так как доход, который имеет Элёр от плотничества не достаточен для удовлетворения всех потребностей семьи. Сейчас Элёр хочет закупить несколько голов скота для дальнейшего вскармливания и продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку скота. Элёр заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Elyor is a positive and friendly man. He is married and has two children. Elyor was able to receive a secondary education. Now he works as a carpenter. He works in construction and renovating private residential properties. He makes a decent income from this. He recently left his parent's home and lives with his wife and children in their own home. He built his own house not long ago.  Currently, Elyor has started his own business of animal husbandry in order to have additional earnings, as his carpenter's salary is not enough to address all the needs of his family. Now Elyor wants to buy several cows to fatten them up and resell them. This is why he turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy cattle. Elyor thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Luis Jorge

texts.es:
Luis tiene 48 años de edad y trabaja en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad  como inspector, con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo  puede sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos a quienes quiere y lucha cada día para brindarle una vida digna.

Luis está agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han dado podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar pisos tarrajear, paredes entre otros, con lo cual le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a  sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luis is 48 years old and works for a transportation company in the city as an inspector. With the income he gains from his modest job he is able to bring up his four children who he loves and who he fights for every day to offer them a decent life.   

Luis is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have given him. Thanks to their help, he has been able to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and more to make home improvements such as laying floors, plastering and other improvements. With this he will be able to give his family a better quality of life and fight so that his dream of making his children into professionals will become reality.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: El Paclom Group

texts.es:
El señor Manolo Medardo es casado. tiene 27 años de edad. De escolaridad 3ro. Básico. Tiene 2 hijos y no esta estudiando. Se dedica al servicio de estructuras metálicas. Inició este negocio ayudando a su padre y hasta le fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servira para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando herramientas que le facilitaran la fabricacion de las estructuras. Desea en el futuro contar con mejor maquinaria para poder aumentar y facilitar el trabajo.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Mr Manolo Medardo is married and is 27 years old. He completed three years of schooling, has two children and is not studying. He began helping his father make metal structures for work and to date he now has six years of experience in this job.

Manolo has organised a group and requested a loan to help him to increase his working capital to buy tools, which will make the construction of the structures a lot easier. In the future he would like to have better machinery to increase his workload and make the job easier. 

The other members of the group work in the shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for their workshop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa esta casada con Alberto tienen  2 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, y que les ayudan cuando tienen las posibilidades de hacerlo.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. 
Consiguió montar su negocio con un poco de dinero que había juntado con el trabajo que hace su marido. 
Su marido trabaja como Guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada en el centro de la Ciudad y de esa manera ayuda a Teresa con los gastos del Hogar. 
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. 
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, arroz, fideo, bebidas y otros con lo que quiere surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa is married to Alberto and they have two children who are already independent adults. They help them out when they have the possibility to do so.

Teresa has a store which is well stocked and very well known in her neighbourhood. She was able to start up her business with a bit of money that she put together from her husband's job. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company in the city centre so he is able to help Teresa with the household bills.

Teresa is a very determined and honest person who is known and liked by everyone who lives in her neighbourhood. She is requesting a loan to invest in flour, rice, pasta, drinks and other items to stock up her store and continue to offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, pasta, drinks and other items

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 14 years. Ana Marie earns more income from raising pigs.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
Aidai is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Journalism and Mass Communication and here is her story.
“The American University of Central Asia is the university of my dreams. I planned to enter this university two years ago and since then I have been studying to the best of my abilities to make my dream come true. I have always tried to find out as much information about AUCA as possible. For this I have been surfing the internet, communicating with current students and my aunt, who also graduated from AUCA. I am really happy that I am a student of AUCA now and that I could make it happen. 
Five years ago I could not even imagine that I would enter the Journalism department. I had a great desire to become a doctor. However, I understood with years that I don’t want to devote my life to medicine. I am such a sociable person. I always try to be in touch with the situation. So, I think that a profession of a journalist suits me most and I have several reasons for this. 
First, a profession of journalist is by far the most interesting one for me. It is always great to learn all the news and to find out some facts that are not open to general public. Secondly, I want to learn how to use words correctly. Unfortunately, nowadays there is too much false information on the Internet. May aim is to tell people true facts about our world. Thirdly, I want to make changes in my lovely country. 
Unfortunately my parents can’t afford full tuition at AUCA. My family is pretty big, which consists of 6 people. So I need a KIVA loan, because it will help me to think about education, to study well and not to think about finance.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Dolores is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers salaries and to buy additional fertilizer.

Dolores has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from direct selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries and buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Халима 54-летняя замужняя женщина. Она родом из района Шахритус. В данный момент Халима нигде не работает, но хочет начать собственный торговый бизнес и быть независимой женщиной. У Халимы имеется опыт в продажах. Она уже приобрела торговую точка на рынке. Халима планирует заняться там продажей женской одежды. Таким образом у нее появится источник дохода и тем самым она улучшит свои жизненные условия. 
   К сожалению, у Халимы недостаточно собственного сбережения чтобы купить товар. Она просит кредит для закупа теплых женских платьев, свитеров, джинсов и другой сезонной одежды. Халима надеется на вашу отзывчивость!
texts.en:
Halima is 54-year-old married woman. She is a native of the Shahrituz district. She currently does not work anywhere, but wants to start her own retail business and be an independent woman. Halima has sales experience. She has already bought her shop location at the market. Halima plans to sell women's clothing there. As result, she will have a source of income and at the same time, improve her living conditions. 
 
Unfortunately, Halima does not have enough personal savings to buy products to sell. She is requesting a loan to buy warm women's dresses, sweaters, jeans and other seasonal clothing. Halima relies on your kind-heartedness!

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing to start her retail business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to Beth.  They have six children, all are in school.

John has an agrovet business in Ndunyu Njeru that he has operated for one year.  He has applied for a first loan from Kadet ltd to enable him buy more stocks of veterinary items for his business.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy chickens for rearing to add to his income.

He hopes to expand his business to improve the living standards of his family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy chickens for rearing

loans.name: Zaynullo

texts.ru: Зайнулло из села Кубадиён. Он в течение нескольких лет работает рабочим на стройке. В Кубодиёне зимой очень холодно, а летом не выносимо жарко. Несмотря на такой климат в этой области жители ремонтируют и строят дома летом, потому что летом сухо и светло. И потому что у них нет выбора. Зимой везде сыро и холодно. Зайнулло работает только по сезонам. То есть на зиму у него нет работы и соответственно нет дохода. Зайнулло дополнительно хочет заняться животноводством. Он собирается закупить несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и держать их в коровнике. По этой причине он берет кредит. Зайнулло надеется, что такая работа принесет ему доход и процветание семье...
texts.en:
Zaynullo is from the village of Qubadiyon. He has worked as a construction worker for several years. In Qubadiyon, the winter is very cold and the summer is unbearably hot. In spite of the climate, residents of this district renovate and build houses in the summer, because in the summer it is dry and light outside. And also because they don't have a choice. In winter, it is damp and cold everywhere. Zaynullo only works seasonally. That is to say, he doesn't work in the winter and, as a result, does not have an income. 

Zaynullo wants to additionally take up animal husbandry. He is planning to buy several cows and keep them in a barn. For this reason he is taking out a loan. Zaynullo hopes that this work will bring him earnings and will bring prosperity to his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start his animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra de 42 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales estudian. Lleva 10 años de trabajar en compra de leche para hacer cuajada, por las mañanas sale a comprar la leche a algunos vecinos que tienen vacas, luego regresa a casa y le hecha cuajo a la leche, después de cierto tiempo, procede a sacar la cuajada, la pone en un recipiente grande y la lleva a entregar a otras clientes que la revenden, para ello debe salir en autobús desde su comunidad hasta la carretera principal, ahí aborda otro autobús y viaja a la ciudad, para entregar su producto y también le vende a varios vecinos en la comunidad. 

 Sandra, solicita $300.00, para comprar algunos utensilios para su trabajo, y para invertir en compra de mas leche, ya que las cantidades que actualmente compra no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  

Al comprar mayor cantidad de leche, sus ingresos serán mayores y además podrá suplir las demandas de su clientela.

Ella esta planificando ahorrar, para que sus hijos continúen estudiando en la universidad, ya que están en bachillerato.
texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years and has a partner and four children who are studying. She has worked for ten years buying milk to make curd. In the morning she goes out to buy milk from some neighbours who have cows and then she comes back home and leaves the milk to curdle. After some time has passed she takes out the curd and puts it into a big container which she delivers to other customers who then resell it. To do this she has to take the bus from her town to the main highway where she gets on another bus and travels to the city to deliver her product and also sell it to various neighbours in the community.

Sandra is applying for a loan of $300 to purchase some utensils for her job and invest in the purchase of more milk, since the quantity she is currently buying isn't enough to satisfy customer demand. Purchasing a larger quantity of milk means her income will also increase and she will be able to meet the demands of her customers. Sandra is planning to save so that her children can continue studying at university as they are in their last year of high school.

loans.use: to buy some utensils for her job and invest in the purchase of more milk

loans.name: Mngumi

texts.en:
Mngumi is 27 years old, male and married. He has two children 7 and 4 years old whom he supports. Mngumi runs a 'boda boda' (motorbike) business which he has run for three years now and operates it within Malindi. He earns a monthly income of Ksh. 5000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member and he is taking out a first loan from Kadet of Ksh.15,000 which he intends to use to service his motorbike.

Mngumi.will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike thus expanding his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business are for it to expand and also to make sure his children get a better education and live well.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
23 de octubre está en su 5to. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, y deben seguir trabajando para mejorar.
Sabina es parte de este grupo, quien por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, también le es de mucha ayuda las capacitaciones que recibe. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, y que según comenta es muy apreciado por sus clientes. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, harina y demás, ya que quiere seguir con sus ventas y deleitar de esa forma a sus clientes y también ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“23 de octubre” is in its fifth cycle of the Women Committee Program. They took part in the poverty elimination survey and two of them were found to be below the poverty line, which means they have a low income and must continue working to improve.

Sabina is a member of this group, who is getting ahead through hard work and sacrifice. She finds the training workshops very helpful. She sells food that she prepares, and her customers like it, according to her. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make her foods, such as vegetables, beef, chicken and flour. She also wants to continue with her business, delight her customers and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, chicken, flour, etc.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a 55-year-old farmer. She also rears poultry for sale. She is a single mother of one child. 

Scholastica has been practising farming for the past five years, with a monthly income of ksh 20,000, which she uses to meet the needs of her child. 

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy animal feed and one bull cow. 

With the expected profit from the farm, she will buy another piece of land to start land farming. 

Her hope and dream is to become a wholesale milk distributor.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and one bull cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal sheets to improve the roof of her home, as well as using another part for some of her study fees

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она шьёт национальные платья и имеет в этой сфере большой опыт. Зебо замужем за доброго человека. Ее муж является мастером по ремонту дома. Зебо и ее муж всегда мечтали, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и стали уважаемыми людьми. Ее сын Пулодчон в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Он учится в факультете Таможенное дело. Зебо должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zebo is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is married and is raising three children. She sews ethnic dresses and has a lot of experience in this field of work. Zebo is married to a good man. Her husband is a home renovation specialist. Zebo and her husband always dreamed that their children would receive a higher education and become respected individuals. This year, her son Pulodjon graduated from secondary school and entered into Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He is studying in the Customs Procedures department. Zebo needs to pay for his tuition and for that reason she is requesting a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a lady of twenty-seven, married to Titus and a mother of two children. She sells charcoal in Kiambu and has been in this business for eight years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Sara's third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal in bulk for her business. In future she wants to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado,  no continuo estudiando, debido al conflicto de la guerra. Él esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya no viven con él, pues cada uno formo su propio hogar, solo vive en casa el que tiene dos años,su compañera trabaja con él en la agricultura, y nadie más vive con ellos.

 Luis, se dedica  a  la agricultura desde  que tenia 8 años, con su papá a prendió el oficio. Él nos contó que su padre le decía que era mejor aprender  a trabajar y que así, podría mantener su hogar cuando se acompañara, hoy en parte agradece a su padre, por que le ha servido para ganarse la vida; pero hoy cree que si hubiere estudiado tendría mejores oportunidades, además, de la agricultura se dedica a cuidar unas 4 vacas que tiene. Su día comienza a las 4:AM, mientras ordeña sus vacas, su señora le prepara el café y su desayuno, para después llevar el ganado al potrero, y quedarse trabajando, unas 6 horas.

El préstamo sera utilizado, en la compra de un toro para las vacas y otra parte para comprar  4 sacos de  abono, para beneficiar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Su sueño es poseer unas 20 vacas lecheras, y así tener para su comida, construir su casa de ladrillo, ya que hoy donde vive esta serrada de madera, además, sueña que su ultimo hijo sea un profesional, pues los otros no quisieron.
texts.en:
48-year-old Luis studied up to the fourth grade. He could not continue studying because of the war. He is in a relationship and has five children. Four of them do not live with him; they have their own families. He lives with his two-year-old child and his partner, who works with him in agriculture.

Luis has worked in agriculture since he was eight, taught by his father. He says that his father told him that it was better to learn how to work in order to maintain his family once he got married. Today, he thanks his father because he can make a living, but he thinks that if he had studied, he would have more opportunities. He also owns four cows. His day starts at 4 am. While he milks the cows, his wife prepares coffee and breakfast. He then takes the cows to graze and continues with his activities for around six hours.

Luis will use the loan to buy a bull for his cows and to buy four bags of compost for a 7,000 m2 plot planted with corn. His dream is to have twenty milk cows that can provide food for the family. He also wants to build a brick house, since he lives in a wooden one at the moment. Finally, he would like to see his youngest son become a professional, since the other children did not want to.

loans.use: to buy a bull for his cows and four bags of compost for his corn plantations.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 11 se encuentra este grupo llamado Las Amigas, que como su nombre lo dice, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas, que quieren ayudarse para salir adelante e ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias.
Catalina quien es parte de este grupo cuenta que vende de productos de belleza, también se dedica a la peluquería en su casa y a la venta de productos de limpieza. Se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que hace ella, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora, que sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando y luchando.
La Sra. Catalina  pide de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás, la ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio. Ella está contenta por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas.
texts.en:
The group called Las Amigas is in its 11th cycle. As it names implies, they are all friends and neighbors who want to help each other get ahead and improve their and their families' lives.  

Catalina, who is a part of this group, says that she sells beauty products and also has a hair salon in her house and sells cleaning products. The big effort she makes must be noted. She is a very hardworking woman who knows that the only way to get ahead is working and struggling. 

Catalina is asking for this loan to buy materials for his hair salon, such as shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more. It will help her to firm up her business plan. She is happy for the opportunity that all of them are receiving.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old, a female and married. She has one one child who is three years old who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer and she has an Mpesa shop. She has been in this business for one year; her business is located in Kijiwetanga. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her second loan of KES 40,000 which she intends to use to add more float to her business. Fatuma will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family is to grow her business and educate her child.

loans.use: To add more float to her business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is single and she lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past 3 years she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business, and she dreams of establishing a big shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has operated a clothes selling business, selling Khangas (women's wrap cloth) from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and competition. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. In addition, she operates a nursery school to supplement her income. 

With the KES 30,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes (Khangas) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she says thank you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes (Khangas) for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 29-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself as committed. He operates a transport business; he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are daily travelers. He says his biggest business challenge is harsh government policies. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts, to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to be stable and successful, within five years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP - DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Semporiana

texts.en:
Semporiana runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Semporiana is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to expand the variety of her stocks thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Semporiana hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is from Nyahururu. He is 27 years old and married to Mary, who is a farmer. They have two children, ages four and one year of whom the four year old is already enrolled in baby class.

Joseph is a dairy farmer who supplies milk to his neighbors. To assist him in making more money from milk sales, he has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which he shall use to buy another dairy cow.

Right now, his monthly income from milk sales is KES 100,000, and he intends to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to buy even more dairy cows.

Joseph's hope and dream for his future business is to be the main milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee cutters.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old man from Kombok in Migori county which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports 4 people in his family and is married to Achieng.  Together they have 5 children who are aged between 6 and 1 year respectively.

Charles has a tailoring shop, which he has been operating for the last 10 years, He currently generates a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

Charles has requested for his fifth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to expand his tailoring business by purchasing more materials in different prints and design for making clothes. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials in different prints and designs

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a 24-year-old single M-pesa agent. Rosaline has been operating her M-pesa for the past nine months with a monthly income of KSH 10,000, which she uses to meet her needs. 

Rosaline is applying for her first loan from KADET. She will use the loan to boost her business by increasing her M-pesa float to meet the needs of her clients. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will further her education as well as repay her loan. 

Rosaline's hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To increase her M-pesa float

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old and has been running his mechanical services and tyre business for 20 years now. He is married and has two children.

This is his sixth loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of vehicle tyres and tubes to sell. Paul anticipates making more income with which he will invest in livestock and cash crop farming. 

In future, Paul hopes to educate his children and grow his business.

loans.use: To buy tyres to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 42 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She runs a primary school that has been in operation for 6 years now. Salome makes a monthly income of KES 17,000.

This is Salome's 5th loan and she will use it to renovate the school. She will buy more desks, build classrooms and buy more learning materials. She will use her profits to add more classrooms as a way of expanding her school. She paid all her previous loans successfully. 

Salome's future hopes and dreams are for her school to grow to a college level.

loans.use: to renovate her school.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 43 years old and married to Lonkisa, a farmer. Her children are aged between 1 year and 15 years of age. She buys and sells cereals to earn a living and makes a monthly income of approximately 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). Rosemary learned about KADET from some women in the market who are already being financed by KADET LTD.

Rosemary has been advaced her fourth loan of 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy more cereals for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to cater for her family's basic needs and educate her children. She hopes to own rental houses in the future. Rosemary is a hardworking lady who is determined to meet her goals with the necessary financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise and vary her stock

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice lives in Kilifi, which is north of Mombasa Kenya. He is a 36-year-old married businessman with four children. He runs a tailoring shop in Kilifi and he has been doing this business for more than ten years. He is the sole income earner for the family and he works everyday to make sure the business succeeds. He started the business from his own savings. 

Maurice learned of Milango Financial Services through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy cloth materials, threads and needles for the business. He hopes that in the next five years his business will grow into wholesale business dealing in all kinds of clothing. He will use the extra income that he will raise to expand his operations.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials, threads and needles,

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 53-year-old married woman with ten children. She makes and sells pop-corn in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Tina needs a loan to buy sack of corn, cooking oil,flour,sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to extend and improve her business.Tina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, cooking oil, flour, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of them are currently in school. For the past eight years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sell clothes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve business by buying more clothes to sell, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to buy things the family needs. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve business by buying more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahoumba

texts.fr: Ahoumba est une femme âgée de 43ans mariée à un imprimeur avec deux enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 15ans et le dernier de 13ans. Elle est revend des produits d´alimentation générale et articles scolaires à toutes personnes. Elle sollicite un second prêt chez WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à ouvrir une deuxième boutique et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Ahoumba is a 43 year old woman who is married to a man working in the printing industry, with whom she has two children aged 15 and 13. She sells food products and school supplies to a variety of customers. She is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase additional material to sell. Profits will help her in opening a second store as well as take care of the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase food products and school supplies

loans.name: Los Tuices Group

texts.es:
El señor Andres es soltero. Cuenta con 54 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Se dedica a la confección de playeras. Inició este negocio comprando una máquina y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una máquina plana para la confeccion de playeras. En el futuro desea contar con un taller con varios operadores y tener un local propio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección y venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Andres is single, 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. He makes t-shirts for a living. He began his business by buying a sewing machine and to date he has five years experience in this line of work. 

Andres formed a group and requested a loan that he will use to buy a flat sewing machine to make t-shirts. In the future he would like to have a workshop with many workers and have his own store.

The other members of the group work making and selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make t-shirts

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 28 years old and has two children. Evalyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Evalyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evalyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of bananas to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a permanent resident of kitebero, a village in Mbarara district, age 38 years old. He is a commercial farmer and married with six children and two dependents from his uncle, who died four years ago. 

All of his children and dependents are in school. From childhood, he has been a farmer dealing in banana sales until 2008, when he learned about the services of Ugafode micro-finance, which funded him with a loan of ugx.2,000,000 to improve on his plantations. 

This made him prosper in life and even managed to build a semi permanent house to accommodate his family. He is requesting a loan ugx.3,000,000 to complete his house and buy solar energy for his home, since he is located in the village where there is no hydro power.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house and solar energy for his home.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 37, is a mother of three children. According to her, she will be the happiest mother if all of her three children could finish their studies. Hardship and difficulties push her to strive hard in her charcoal sales business. 

Analiza desires to generate higher sales and profit. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 which will be used to purchase charcoal and piglets for her new hog-fattening business. She hopes that through her loan and determination she can improve her lifestyle and financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and piglets for her retail business.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has a tailoring business in Nairobi town and has been running it for the last 19 years. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more sewing materials for use in her business. These include textile materials of different types as well as threads and buttons. She will use the anticipated income to open another tailoring business. This is her sixth loan term and she paid back all her previous loan successfully.

She hopes to become successful in her business and enable her children to achieve the best education and live a successful life in future.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Chiquito

texts.en:
Chiquito resides in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, he grows and harvests coconuts and sells them in the town while his wife sells seafood in the market. Having five children is not easy, so he works twice as hard to try and earn income for the family. He plans to plant vegetables on his farm to earn more money. 

He took a new loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. He dreams of having a successful farm and being able to support the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new display cabinet and more stock such as sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda has been pig fattening for 24 years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ausberto

texts.es:
Ausberto de 34 años de edad, solo estudio  primer grado, esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa,  tiene dos hijos, y están estudiando.   

Él  es barbero de profesión y lo ejerce desde hace 7 años, su papá fue quien le enseño el trabajo. Antes de ser barbero,trabajo en la agricultura. Además, trabajo 5 años en una maquila, pero le tocaba viajar lejos y no tenia casi tiempo para su familia,  un día que se encontraba preocupado por que no tenia nada para su familia,se acordó de las palabras que le dijo su padre. “Esto te va ha servir, cuando tengas tu hogar”, y hoy agradece lo que su padre le enseño con ese trabajo, esta sacando a delante a su familia, y lo mejor es que pasa más tiempo con ellos. Su horario es desde las 7: 00 AM, hasta las 2:30 PM porque después se va con su familia para la iglesia.       

El préstamo sera invertido en la compra de una docena y media de lamina, y madera para construir su casa porque donde hoy vive, no es de él. Su sueño, es poder cancelar el crédito, para tener las puertas abiertas, porque su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo y ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ausberto is 34 years old. He only went to school through the first grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has two children and they are in school.   

He is a barber by trade and has done this for 7 years. His father was the one who taught him this work.  Before becoming a barber, he worked as a farmer. In addition,  he worked in a factory, but he had to commute a long way and he barely had time with his family. One day, he was worried because he had nothing for his family. He remembered his father's words: "this will be useful for you when you have a home". Today he is grateful that his father taught him this work. He is getting his family ahead and the best thing is that he spends more time with them.  His schedule is from 7: 00 AM till 2:30 PM, because later he goes to church with his family.       

The loan will be invested in buying a dozen and a half of sheeting and wood to build his house because where he lives now isn't his. His dream is to pay off the loan to keep his doors open. His dream is to build a brick house and for his children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy a dozen and a half of sheeting, and wood to build his house because where he lives now isn't his.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a 49-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. The oldest child is 25 while the youngest is 6 years old. Rufa engages in farming. She grows and sells rice as a source of income. Her farming business started more than 10 years ago. 

Rufa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay a laborer's fee to yield more harvest.

In the future, Rufa hopes to expand her farming business and invest in another business to provide additional income so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers, medicines and pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his working capital and purchase 320 outfits to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 36 years old, a shopkeeper, and a single mother to one child. Carolyne has been running her shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to provide for her family. 

Carolyne is applying for her first loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to stock her shop with more commodities like fruits in season and small-scale home products. With the anticipated profit from the business she will be able to expand her business and get commodities in large-scale.

Carolyne's hopes and dreams are to be a wholesale distributor in the near future.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more commodites

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan  de 30 años de edad, solo estudio 4° grado, debido que su papá no vio importante el estudio.  él esta acompañado, y su pareja trabaja con él en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos,el mayor ya esta en la escuela.

 Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia unos 10 años, pues su padre siempre lo llevo a trabajar en la siembra de maíz, y fue con él que aprendió el oficio. Además, de trabajar en la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, también cuida unas 3 vacas que tiene, pues siempre le a gustado tener animales, ya que de ellos sale para el sustento del hogar.


 Se levanta muy temprano, para ordeñar sus vacas y luego irse a trabajar, su  compañera es la que lleva el ganado al potrero,para que él logre el día, su vida es un poco agitada pero agradece a Dios por todo lo ha dado.   


El crédito, sera invertido en la compra de unos 4 terneros para repasto, ya que  después que sale de la cosecha queda el rastrojo para el ganado y es una manera de ganar unos dolares.

Su sueño, es tener un día una 10 vacas lecheras,ver a sus hijos graduarse en una profesión, comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, ya que donde vive es de un hermano.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old and only studied up until the fourth grade, as his father didn't think that his studies were important. Juan has a partner who works in agriculture and two children, the oldest being now at school.

Juan has worked in agriculture since he was about 10 years old. His father always took him to work when they were planting maize, which is when he learnt how to do this job. In addition to planting maize, beans and sorghum, Juan also takes care of three cows. He has always liked having animals since they provide a way of sustaining the home.

Juan gets up very early to milk the cows and later goes to work. His partner is the one who leads the cattle to pasture. Getting through the day is a bit stressful, but he gives thanks to God for everything He has given him.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of four calves to fatten up, since after the harvest the stubble is left over for the cattle and it's a way to make some money.

Juan's dream is to one day have 10 dairy cows, see his children graduate as professionals, and buy a plot of land and build his own house, as he currently lives in his brother's house.

loans.use: to buy four calves to fatten up

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 and has a tricycle which is operated by her husband while she is engaged in selling fish as an additional source of her family income. She and her husband work together to improve their living conditions. The couple both wants to let their three children finish their studies and achieve their dreams in life.

To realize her goals, Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy oil and steel parts. A part of the loan will also be used to buy fish. She hopes that this loan will strengthen her transportation and fish selling businesses and make them profitable and productive. In this way, she could further improve her financial status and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy oil, steel parts and fish.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 29 years old and married with three children who are in school. Genelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genelyn runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 56-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children.The youngest child is 19. She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice as her main source income. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay labor fees so that she can get a bigger yield.  

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay laborer fees.

loans.name: Najuka

texts.en:
Najuka is a 35-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Parsha tole in Kalaiya Municipality of Bara district Nepal. She was married at the age of twenty seven and started the sewing occupation in her own home in the initial years. As demand for her work started peaking, she set up her tailoring shop with the assistance of credit from Nirdhan Utthan Bank Ltd. Now she has an additional four sewing machines in her tailoring shop. 

Najuka wants to set up another tailoring shop in her village so she has requested NPR 20,000 to buy a sewing machine and set up the tailoring shop. 

Najuka has earned local community respect. She wants to inspire fellow women to be entrepreneurs in her village and hopes to give good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for setting up a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ginalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce, salts, etc. to sell.

Ginalyn has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce and salts to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salary during the sugarcane harvest. 

Fely has been in this business for 13 years. Fely earns additional income from raising pigs.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salary during harvest.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
For four years in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Liza, a 44-year-old married mother of two, has made a living by operating a retail store. She sells a variety of food and home-use products, earning 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. Her husband is a farmer, their main source of income. 

Her costumers have requested that she get additional products to sell; she was encouraged to buy feed and rice to sell, in addition to her other stock.

In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Her previous loan, used in the business, was successfully repaid. 

Now she is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Umoja - Daraja Group

texts.en:
Judy, who is in her early 40s, is single with a boy and a girl who are in school. Since 1998, Judy has been managing her life by running a business selling second-hand clothes; she is doing great in her business. Judy works from 08am to 08pm each working day, and is able to earn a good return from this activity. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Judy used her previous loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She used her profit to cover school fees, food expenses for her family, and reinvested back to her business. 

Judy will use this loan to buy more clothes to sell to more people. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a mini-supermarket.  

She will share this loan with her loan group " UMOJA-DARAJA" which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en:
Janalyn is 41 years old and has four children. She is married, and has three children who are in school.

Janalyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines; she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janalyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo is a 34-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, giant plants and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Alaimalo has requested a loan to to buy bush knives, crowbar, weed killer and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Alaimalo hopes to improve her business and support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, crowbar, weed killer and chemicals

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas lleva por nombre este grupo de Encarnación, el cual, gracias a su esfuerzo están en el sexto ciclo del programa de comités, recibiendo capacitaciones e instrucciones de como invertir sus créditos. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una puede saber su situación de pobreza y conforme a eso poder trabajar y mejorar.
Cynthia es una de ellas, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien vende ropas y zapatos. Cuenta que al principio le costo un poco empezar con su trabajo, pero que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela, hace también sobre pedidos y así esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas de todo tipo, para poder ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes y también poder atraer a mas.
texts.en:
This group from Encarnacion calls themselves "Mujeres unidas" (Women united). Thanks to their efforts, this is their sixth loan cycle with the communal bank program, which empowers them and gives them instructions on how to invest their loan. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, through which each person can know their level of poverty and can work and improve accordingly.

Cynthia, one of the group, is a very hardworking person, who sells clothing and shoes. She tells in the beginning it was a little difficult for her to begin with her work, but that now she has very good customers and also fills orders. In this way she is getting ahead and helping her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in buying all types of clothing, in order to be able to offer a good variety to her clients and to also be able to attract more.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who has four children. She is 46 years old and resides at Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

Marieta owns and operates a charcoal business to earn a living and she's been in this business for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. In addition to this, she also buys charcoal to resell in bulk for a higher price. With this strategy, she will be able to earn more profit. Her previous loan from GDMPC was successfully repaid and recently, she borrowed a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase wood and charcoal to resell. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase wood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Jane is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cream, etc. for her food vending business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Knox

texts.en:
Mr. Knox and the entire REEP (Rural Economic Empowerment Program) fraternity wish to sincerely thank Kiva lenders for the previous loan. The loan enabled Knox to purchase solar lanterns which he sold to interested REEP members on short term loans, repayed with a small amount of interest. The beneficiaries of the lanterns have finished repaying their loans and now are happy they no longer have to spend money on kerosene. They recount that these lanterns are ideal for children to read and write by; they are portable for farmers to use to go about their daily chores after sunset; they are able to charge their mobile phones and brighten up their dwellings. 

The organization group membership has increased from 400 groups to 520 groups in the last one year. Among the products offered by REEP, solar lanterns have been the most successful product because of their huge economic and social value: cutting down the recurring paraffin costs and carbon emissions. 

Mr. Knox is determined to replace all the smoky unsafe candles and kerosene lamps among the members with the solar lanterns which offer bright and safe light and come with a mobile phone charging function. There is still a huge portion of the group without solar lanterns, so the demand is still very high for him to meet from his limited cash flow. Knox is therefore requesting a new loan to buy more lanterns for selling to the members. On the uploaded photo is Knox with Loice, a member of one of the new groups to join REEP.  She has just purchased a solar lamp on a loan from REEP.

loans.use: to buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 31-year-old married woman. She has had a business selling milk for about five years. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Zundui

texts.en: Zundui is 59 years old and  lives with his wife in Ger, in a traditional nomadic tent in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Serjmaa helps her husband to run their family business of agriculture. Their children are married and live apart with their own families. Zundui and his wife have been operating an organic vegetable and wheat growing business for more than twenty years. He also helps and supports newly starting businesses to prepare their planting, etc. His wife sells organic vegetables and barley flour in the local market.
