He is requesting 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolia Tughriks) to purchase wheat harvesting equipment for his business. He is a hardworking, honest, and helpful man.

loans.use: to purchase wheat harvesting equipment for his business

loans.name: Borjin

texts.en: Mr. Borjin is 32 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Bayantsetseg runs a small tailoring business at home. Borjin has been driving a heavy truck since he was 18 and has been providing transportation services by rented vehicle until 2012. At that time he purchased his own truck, and he continues to provide transportation services to make a living. His truck needs to have the tires replaced otherwise he will have to temporarily stop his business. He is now requesting a loan of 750,000 MNT to purchase a set of tires to replace his old ones to continue providing his transportation service. He is a hardworking, diligent and reasonable man.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires to replace his old ones to continue providing his transportation service

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee and milk to sell in her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns income from farming sugarcane.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee and milk to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is running a general store while his wife is working a a teacher. He has been in this business for more than five years as an aid to his wife's income. He borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase livestock feed, rice and dried fish for sale. He plans to save a portion of his profit for future family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, rice and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'High returns.' His biggest challenge is 'Lack of proper funding.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Terett.'

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it gives out loans at a low interest.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It has a low interest rate.'

His highest monthly expenses are transportation costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Peter replied 'More income through new investment ventures.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Chroeurn

texts.en:
Chroeurn (pictured at home) hopes to continue his studying. He is in his first semester of his second year. Hence he decided to apply for a second education loan to pay his school fees.

Chroeurn is single and lives with his parents, brother and sister in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His parents are rice farmers; his brother is a fisherman and his sister is a garment worker.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Urcilina

texts.en:
Urcilina is a 55-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has 10 children. The youngest child is 14. 

She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. Her business started more than 10 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for fertilizers and laborer's fee in order to gain more harvest and meet the family's daily needs.
  
In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and laborer's fee.

loans.name: Hishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Hishigsuren is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.

Her husband Ganbold works at a local company as a welder. Her daughters both attend local schools. 

Hishigsuren has been working as hairdresser in a barber shop since 2007 and has regular clients. She is now planning to open her own small barber shop and employ 2 or 3 other hairdressers to start her business. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials and equipment to renovate her workplace and start her business. She is a hardworking, diligent and welcoming lady.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and equipment to renovate her workplace and start her business

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 27 years old and married to Violet. He supports three members of the family. 

He runs a tailoring shop and is also a farmer. He has operated these businesses for four years, and currently gets a monthly income is ksh 6,000.

Joshua is borrowing a loan of ksh 30,000, which he intends to use to purchase more stock of materials for his tailoring business. This is his second loan; he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of materials

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money for her cloth selling business. Beside the cloth selling business, she prepares meat goat soup and sells to her customers. She prepares meat goat soup using goat heads and legs.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.The loan of KSH 50,000 she is requesting will help her to purchase more goat heads and legs for her business

loans.use: To purchase more goat heads and legs for her business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business, so Naseem has requested a loan of Rs 25,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle, having a good credit repayment history. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. 

She would like to teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business, and also to earn money for themselves. In addition, she is interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has three buffaloes, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Kaneez has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Simkhan

texts.en: Simkhan is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village of Gardabani district. Simkhan is involved in agricultural activities. He works hard on the family-owned land growing maize and tomatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers at a good price. In addition, the family owns 3 cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. Simkhan decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $ 1100 for purchasing a used car to start a trading business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell in the capital city of Georgia. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a fruit and vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffalos and five goats, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also deals in the business of animal sales and purchases to generate an extra amount of profit.  Nasreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Preveen

texts.en: Preveen is 27 years old, a married woman and mother of seven children; one of her sons is shown in the photo and the man shown in the photo is Preveen’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena is a 25-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for many years and is now an expert in the field. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer and does not earn enough to support his family well. Her hand skills are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 7 children and wants to grow her business to provide them with a quality lifestyle. Haseena has requested a loan of Rs 30,000, to buy raw materials such as sequins, beads, thread and stones in large varieties and quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use the profits on her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as sequins, beads, thread and stones in large varieties and quantities.

loans.name: Sialeia

texts.en:
Sialeia is a 53-year-old married woman with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has four years of experience in this line of business. 

Sialeia needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads and materials. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads and materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old, married and has four children.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising poultry. 

Mary requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

Mary has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Nissa

texts.en:
Mary Nissa works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Mary Nissa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

Mary Nissa has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Mercelita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

Mercelita has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 31 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase a water pump for her business. Beside her fish-selling business, she also sells both men's and women's clothes. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more bales of clothes for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
This is Mejumaa. She previously accessed a loan that she used to renovate her business premises.

She would like to apply for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy food ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans, and onions for her business. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans and onions for her business.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 42-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 

Nasreen is a motivated mother of five and is liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of PKR 30,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. 

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 22-year old entrepreneur living in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. He recently moved out of his family's home to live on his own, but he has found that the going has not been easy due to unemployment. Nickson has tried out several small businesses as a means to fend for his food and a place to stay, but the money he earns is not enough to take care of all his needs. However, Nickson discovered Fresh Life toilets, and believes this business will pay for his living expenses.

Nickson seeks a loan to help him purchase two Fresh Life toilets, which he intends to run himself. He hopes that the business will generate enough to improve his living standards and create more employment opportunities for other youth.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 45ans et mariée à un commerçant avec 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école. Elle est revendeuse ; elle revend des fruits (oranges, bananes) à tous clients. Elle vend au marché d’akodésséwa. Elle a commencé à exercer depuis 1993. Elle demande son premier prêt chez WAGES pour la vente des fruits et acheter un terrain. Elle envisage augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et assurer la bonne éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a 45-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has three children, including two in school. She is a retailer and sells fruit (oranges and bananas) to all comers. She sells at the Akodésséwa market. She started operations in 1993. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to sell fruit and to purchase a plot of land. She envisions increasing her sales and ensuring the right education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruit (oranges and bananas)

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 54 years old and married with five children.

Merlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Merlyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Merlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is running a general store in the village of Oroquieta City, while her husband is earning as a seaman. She has been in this business for more than three years to make a living. Her income was good enough to support the needs of her three children. 

In order to improve the business, she borrowed a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase additional goods like canned items, cereal, milk, sugar and butter. She hopes to earn more income to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned items, cereal, milk, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from the town of Kobuleti, which is a Black Sea resort visited annually by Georgian and many former Soviet Union holidaymakers. She is 54 years old and lives alone in her own house. 

Rita earns a living through clothing sales. Specifically, she gets apparel from the local retailers and sells for a small profit among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores, Rita's business has a high demand. She is very nice to her customers and does her job with love and care. 

She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices and continue her business. Rita will be able to get more profit and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to purchase stock of apparel for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is happy that she was able to get a Kiva loan. She repaid the loan without challenges. She used the previous loan to buy salon products such as hairpieces and shampoo for her salon. Her business improved, and she was able to pay school fees for her three children. 

She now seeks another loan to add stock of hair oil and weaves for the business. She will use the extra income that she will raise to add more products to her business.

loans.use: to buy hair oil and weaves.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 51 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia.  For the last 10 years, Sokhom has been raising pigs. She also sells coffee in the village. She earns about 50,000 KHR a day to meet the family’s needs.

Sokhom is the leader of her group.  They are requesting a loan from VisionFund. Sokhom will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feeds for nourishing them. She hopes this loan will fatten her pigs so she can make a living better.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. 

She has been running a business of cloth sales for many years. She purchases a variety of printed cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Balqees requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en:
Samreen is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for the past six years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also deals in a business of animal sales and purchase on a seasonal basis. 

At present, she has two buffaloes in milk. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales and ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: El Mantial Del Pariachi Group

texts.es: Julia de 36 años casada con 01 hijo dependiente, actualmente es socia   del grupo  “El Manantial De Pariachi”  constituida por 07 mujeres trabajadoras. Julia  cuenta con un restaurante en su vivienda, donde ofrece almuerzo todos los días de la semana pues cuenta con clientes fijos. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Julia ha terminado de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de insumos, pues comprará en mayores cantidades como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros productos y así poder preparar sus comidas.  Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. La Alcancía Comunal “El Manantial De Pariachi” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible esté crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Julia es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa negra y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old, married, with one dependent child. She is one of the seven hard-working woman who make up the "El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank. Julia has a restaurant in her house where she offers lunch every day of the week. She has regular clients. With the fruits of her labor Julia has finished building her house. 

Julia is requesting this loan to buy supplies like rice, sugar, pasta, etc. to prepare her meals. She will buy them in large quantities. Her wish is to continue growing her business. The "El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank thanks those that make this loan possible and promise to continue working hard. Julia is second to the right, wearing a black sweater and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Siulala

texts.en:
Siulala is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, papaya, cocoa and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Siulala has requested a loan to buy taro tubes, bush knives, weed killer, a crowbar and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, she hopes to support her family, her children's education and to improve her business as well.

loans.use: to buy taro tubes, bush knives, weed killer, a crowbar and chemicals.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Le grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” está conformada por 10 socias y socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio. Jaqueline tiene 41 años es conviviente con 02 hijos en el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. Hace muchos años implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. De esta  manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega y mejorar la fachada de su vivienda. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jaqueline  es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa de Lima Group is made up of ten members who work in various commercial activities.

Jaqueline, 41, lives with her partner and has two children.  She's the treasurer of the group.  Many years ago she set up a small grocery store in her home to help her husband with the children's school expenses.  Her greatest desire is to expand her store and improve the front of her house.

Jaqueline will invest the loan in rice, sugar, and oil.

The group's grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Jaqueline's the first person seated on the left; she wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Mujeres Mayas Group

texts.es:
La señora María Angelica es casada. Cuenta con 30 años de edad. De escolaridad 2do. primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la fabricación de canastos. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concedío su madre y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar hilo para la fabricacion de canastos. Desea en el futuro tener mas capital de trabajo y un almacen de venta de canastos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa, elaboracion de bordados y canastas.

Una de las socias no pudo asistir a la reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
María Angelica is 30 years old and is married. She has education up to second grade of primary school. She has 5 children and 3 of them are at school. María Angelica earns a living making baskets. She started her business with a small amount of capital which her mother gave her and has had the business for 10 years. She is the organizer of a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to buy thread for making the baskets. In the future she would like to have more capital and a store to sell the baskets. 

The other members of the group earn a living selling clothing, doing embroidery and making baskets. 

One of the members was unable to attend the meeting when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread for making baskets

loans.name: Amaraa

texts.en:
Mrs. Amaraa is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her husband, Gombodorj, is 52 and operates a taxi service business. Her 3 children are married and live apart.

Amaraa has been running her butcher shop business in the local market since 2005. She is well-known for her friendly service and tasty meat products. She is now involving her husband in her business. He is starting to be in charge of purchasing meat products from a bigger market where herders sell their livestock. 

Amaraa is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to repair her husband's car so he can use it for transporting her meat supply. Thus, he will be employed in her business. The Gombodorjs are a happy, hardworking and respected family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her husband's car to use as transportation of her meat supply and employ her husband in her business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells nipa roofing in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She earns additional income from selling seafood. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nipa roofing

loans.name: Sicelia

texts.en:
Sicelia appreciates for her previous loan that improved her living standards.Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used to stock her retail shop.

She also operates a vegetable stall beside the retail shop. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes and fruits for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en:
Kayed is a 21-year-old, single man who works in collecting and selling metal scrap. He has been working in this domain for two years. He puts so much effort into developing his business to make sure that it will provide him with a good income to cover his needs and improve his living. 

Kayed is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian camp and partially works to collect metal from the nearby villages. 

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to continue building his own house, which is his dream to come true, so he can make his own small family in the future. 

Kayed's future plan is to open his own metal scrap plot and to increase his capital.

loans.use: to continue building his own house, which is his dream to come true, so he can make his own small family in the future.

loans.name: Milagros 1 Group

texts.es:
Milagros I está en su ciclo número 12º  del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y es gracias al esfuerzo que cada una hace, que están mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Deysi es vendedora de cosméticos de todo tipo, y es con esfuerzo y gran trabajo que está saliendo adelante. Las capacitaciones que están recibiendo también le han sido de mucha ayuda para poder saber cómo invertir su dinero. Ella es una persona dinámica que siempre está tratando de mejorar día con día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de distintas marcas, y poder cumplir así con pedidos que tiene a la vez que va a poder ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientas, y así ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Milagros I is in the twelfth cycle of the committee programme. They are doing the poverty elimination survey and thanks to the efforts they are all making, they are improving their level of poverty. The training they are getting has also been a great help in knowing how to invest the money. 

Deysi sells all kinds of cosmetics and it is through hard work and determination that she is making progress in life. She is a dynamic person who is constantly trying to improve. She is asking for the loan to buy different brands of cosmetics so she can fulfil orders that she has as well as offering her customers a better variety, so she can keep improving her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 27-year-old single man, who has worked in an agricultural business for ten years. He has specialized in raising cattle in his own farm and trading the milk to support his family as he is their main breadwinner. Habib is responsible for the living of nine members of his family, that's why in 2011, he started his own business by opening his own farm.
Because of his family's increasing needs, Habib is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to start a new additional business to make sure that he can cover his family's needs in a better way. He will work as a blacksmith, and this loan will help him open his own shop where he can put all the equipment and tools he needs to make sure his business will develop easily.
He hopes to keep on expanding and developing both businesses to make sure he can respond better to his family's increasing financial needs.

loans.use: To start an additional income business to improve his family's living standards

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children, and two of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has dealt in a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She has two buffaloes and two goats. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has four children, who attend school. For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

Rose is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase stocks of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда родилась в 1960 года. Она вдова. Мавлюда имеет 3 детей. Она с 1976 года работала в шелк-комбинате. Ее муж умер в 2009 года. Мавлюда после смерти мужа пережила глубокий стресс. Она поменяла место работы. Мавлюда данное время работает в частном производственной компании. Мавлюда живет вместе с сыном, невесткой и 2 внуками. Ее невестка портниха, а ее сын тоже простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату. Ее внука надо лечить. Ему необходимо сделать операция глаза. Он плохо видит. Мавлюда запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для операции внука. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavluda was born in 1960. She is a widow. Mavluda has three children. Since 1976, she worked in a silk factory. Her husband died in 2009. Mavluda experienced intense stress after the death of her husband. She changed her place of work. Mavluda currently works in a private manufacturing company. Mavluda lives with her son, his fiancée, and two grandchildren. Her son's fiancée is a seamstress and her son is simple blue-collar worker who receives a small salary. Her grandson needs medical treatment. It's necessary for him to have an eye operation. He does not see well. Mavluda is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni for her grandson's operation. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her grandson's eye operation.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Arroyo Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras de Arroyo Pora es un grupo relativamente nuevo, que busca la oportunidad de poder mejorar sus labores. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no, están con proyectos de iniciar una actividad y así emprender.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, y el crédito lo pide para invertir en la compra de insumos varios para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, pollo y otros. Según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza de Estela, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero de igual manera ella tiene deseos de invertir en su negocio para poder aumentar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras de Arroyo Pora group is a relatively new group, who are looking for an opportunity to improve their work. The majority of the members have productive businesses and those who don't are in the process of starting out in a business.

One of the members is Estela, who earns a living making and selling food. She is asking for the loan to buy various supplies so she can carry on making her food, such as meat, condiments, vegetables, chicken and other items. According to Estela's poverty elimination survey, she is improving her poverty situation, but she still wants to invest in her business so she can increase her income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, chicken and other items.

loans.name: Nonima

texts.en:
Nonima is 61 years old, married, and has nine children. 

Nonima is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nonima requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nonima has been pig fattening for twenty years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo works hard to support his family. Ronaldo is married, and he has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines.

Ronaldo has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Ronaldo has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ronaldo would like to build and expand his business to secure the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Sunnary's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sunnary is a 36-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are still in school. 

To earn a living, Sunnary has been farming rice and growing vegetables around her house. This business earns her about KHR 36,000 per day. However, she can manage to save about KHR 20,000 each day, after deducting daily expenses. 

Sunnary has been with VisionFund Cambodia for six cycles while her co-member has been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles. The past loans have helped Sunnary to provide better support to her family. 

Now, Sunnary and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, Sunnary will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lengiy's Group

texts.en:
LengIy is 31 years old and a married mother, residing in Kampong Cham province. 

As a mother of one little kid who still counts on her, she farms one hectare of rice cropping as the main source of income, with support from her husband. It is a business that she has involved with for four years. 

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Lengly and two other borrowers are teaming up as a group of three to get the first loan.  The total amount that her entire group is requesting is KHR 1,700,000. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. 

She hopes that she can make a good income from her business so she can provide decent food for her child and improve the family's living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang is 25 years old and married, with one son. She and her family live in a village in the Cheuny Prey district of Kampong Cham province. 

To make a living, Sreyneang and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee, for six years, earning about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.  

Sreyneang’s Group is in their first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now, Sreyneang is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gaufa

texts.en:
Gaufa is 47 years old and married, with six children.

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Gaufa has requested a loan to buy taro tubes, bush knives, boots, hose, a wheel-barrow, and chemicals.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Gaufa hopes to support her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to buy taro tubes, bush knives, boots, hose, axes, a wheel-barrow, and chemicals.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Уроженцы Шахритуса как и другие жители разных сел и деревень республики Таджикистана занимаются животноводством или растениеводством. Причина, по которой эти деятельности столь популярны является благоприятный климат республики и не испорченная природа. Взяв пример со своих земляков 30-летний Эргаш начинает свою деятельность по купле и продаже крупнорогатых скотов. Началом в его бизнесе будет закуп нескольких голов бычков и телят. Чтобы совершить эту покупку Эргашу не хватает собственного сбережения. Сумму, которую он просит в кредит для такого бизнеса является малым. Потому что многие породы крупнорогатого скота очень дорогие. Эргаш к будущему бизнесу относится очень серьезно, ведь для него это очень важно, так как он единственный кормилец своей семьи и сейчас он безработный. Эргаш надеется на Вашу помощь!
texts.en: Natives of Shahrituz, like residents of other towns and villages in the Republic of Tajikistan, practice animal husbandry and crop farming. This business has become popular due to the advantageous climate of the Republic and the unspoiled natural environment. Taking an example from his fellow countrymen, 30-year-old Ergash is starting his own business of buying and reselling cattle. The start of his business will be the purchase of several bulls and calves. Ergash does not have enough personal savings to make this purchase. The loan amount he is requesting for his business is relatively small, as many breeds of cattle are very expensive. Ergash is very serious about his future business, as it is very important for him as the only provider in his family and he is currently unemployed. Ergash relies on your help!

loans.use: to buy four bulls and calves.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is married, with three school-aged children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Charity has operated a clothes-selling business for the past ten years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, Charity wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es:
Nuria tiene 23 años,  está casada con el Sr. Stiven hace 3 años,  tienen 1 hijo juntos de 2 años.
La Sra. Nuria es una joven emprendedora quien cuenta que empezó primeramente trabajando de forma ambulante para luego con su clientela ya  formada habilitar un moderno y atractivo local hace un año. Comenta que es un trabajo minucioso y delicado ya que trabaja a crédito con sus clientes Está muy contenta con su trabajo porque se siente realizada siendo independiente y poder demostrar su capacidad de autogestión, ya que a la vez debe educar a su hijo en la ausencia de su padre, el mismo trabaja fuera de la ciudad. Su sueño es tener sucursales de su boutique y así poder llegar a más sector de clientes brindando calidad y buen precio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, joyas, zapatos, lencería que venderá y podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando su clientela.
texts.en: Nuria is 23 years old and has been married to Stiven for 3 years. They have a two-year-old son. Nuria is a young businesswoman who first started working door-to-door. One year ago, once she had established a customer base, she opened a modern and attractive store. She explains that her job is meticulous and can be tricky because her customers buy on credit. She is happy with her job because she feels satisfied to be working independently and she is able to show her her managerial skills and organization, especially as she also has the job of educating her son as his father works out of town. Her dream is to open more branches of her boutique so that she can reach more customers, giving them quality at a good price. She is requesting this loan to  invest in the purchase of blouses, pants, shirts, jewelry, shoes, and lingerie to sell so that she can continue growing her business and increasing the amount of customers she serves.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, jewelry, shoes, and lingerie.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn, 38, is widowed and lives with one child in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items for ten years, earning about 50,000 KHR (Cambodia Riels) per day to feed her family.

Sophorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, Sophorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to increase her income in order to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Age 44 and a resident from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Chan is a married mother of four children. 

For the entire household, grocery selling in the front yard of her house and rice farming on six hectares of land are the main sources of income to support her living. She has been involved in the current business for 14 years, earning about KHR 32,800 per day. 

This is the fourth microloan for Chan’s Group, consisting of three borrowers. They would each like to get a new loan of KHR 1,000,000. 

Chan has succeeded in completely repaying her past loans and the loans have promptly supported her business quite well. As the leader, Chan will spend her loan portion to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make a good income from her businesses, so that she can buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is a 24-year-old, married man. He lives in the capital city of Georgia with his wife, three-year-old daughter, and mother. His mother works as a lawyer and gets Gel 400 per month. 

Lasha serves local people as a taxi driver. He decided to install a gas apparatus in his car to reduce expenses. 

The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of USD 1,000 to install a gas apparatus in his car. When the fuel system is changed, Lasha will be able to reduce his costs and, thus, increase the income of his family. 

The start-up program will be a great support to the family.

loans.use: to install a gas apparatus in his car.

loans.name: Carlos Exequiel

texts.es:
Carlos de 26 años, estudio hasta 7° grado, debido a la pobreza que vivían  decidió, dejar la escuela para ayudar a los gastos de la casa, esta casado, su esposa tiene una venta de tortillas, solo tienen una niña de 6 meses de edad.

Carlos trabaja en la siembra de maíz, pipían y maicillo,desde que tenia unos 12 años, fue  con su papá que aprendió el oficio. Además, se dedica al trabajo de albañil, y fue su padre quien le enseño. Comenta que para a provechar bien el tiempo se levanta a las 5: 00 AM, pues le toca que caminar unos cuarenta y cinco minutos, para llegar donde  trabaja, y son  6 horas que trabaja y regresa  a casa. Pero por la tarde trabaja en su cultivo que él siembra.   

El crédito, sera invertido en la siembra de 14,000 metros  cuadrados de maíz y 7,000  de maicillo, comprara 9 sacos de abono, una bolsa de semilla, 2 galones de herbicidas, 2 litros de pesticidas y lo demás para pago de tractor y mano de obra.

Su sueño, es  adquirir un terreno  y construir su propia casa, ya que hoy vive en una casa que es de su suegra y  ver a su hija graduarse en una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old and studied up to 7th grade. Due to their situation of poverty he decided to leave school to help with the household expenses. He is married. His wife has a business selling tortillas and they have one little girl who is 6 months old. 

Carlos has been growing corn, "pipián" [a type of squash] and sorghum since he was 12 years old, having learnt the skills with his father. He also works as a bricklayer and his father also taught him this. He says that to make good use of time he gets up at 5am, as he has to walk for 45 minutes to get to his place of work, works for 6 hours and then returns home. In the afternoon he looks after the crops which he sows himself. 

The loan will be used to sow 14,000 square metres of corn and 7,000 of sorghum. He will buy 9 bags of fertilizer, a bag of seed, 2 gallons of herbicide and 2 litres of pesticide and the rest will pay for a tractor and manual labour.

Carlos's dream is to buy a plot of land and build his own house, as he currently lives in a house belonging to his mother-in-law, and he also wants to see his daughter graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to plant 14,000 square metres of corn and 7,000 of sorghum, to buy 9 bags of fertilizer, a bag of seed, 2 gallons of herbicide and 2 litres of pesticide and to pay for a tractor and labour.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 21-year-old, single woman who works as a tutor at her house, inside the camp where she lives, since she is a Palestinian refugee, with limited access to several working sectors in Lebanon. It has been two years since she started providing this service to her camp citizens. This is her only source for living and for covering her educational expenses. 

Siham is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to pay for her university expenses and she hopes that, one day, she’ll graduate and work in her domain as she dreams to do.

loans.use: to pay for her university expenses.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Nhanh, 23, is single. The sources of her income are from rice farming, growing beans and corn. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for three years, she is able to earn about 17,000 KHR and she can manage to save about 9,000 KHR each day after expenses. 
 
This is the first loan for Nhanh with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Hieng's Group

texts.en:
Hieng, 41, is a mother of seven children. She is originally from Bakan district of Pursat Province. Hieng sells soup and porridge as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for ages and it has returned her almost 30,000 KHR per day. 

Hieng is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva‘s partner) and she is a leader of a group consisting of three borrowers who apply for the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Hieng will spend her loan portion to buy a plot of farmland to build a decent house for her family. She hopes that she can own a proper house as others so that she does not worry much about her house condition during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Clement, who is in his early 40s, is married, with four children who are in school. 

For 15 years now, Clement has been running two businesses. One is a general store shop and another is a grocery business. He employed a few helpers in his business.  Clement works from 6am to 11pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Clement's 18th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to open a grocery business where he restocked more drinks and bought more shop items and he bought one cow for a milk-selling production. 

Clement has managed to successfully pay back all his loans. He used his profit to pay school fees and household expenses and he built a house. 

He will use this loan to restock grocery drinks and other shop items to resell. Clement dreams to build a house for renting and to open a bar. 

Clement will share this loan with his loan group, Mema Group, which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock grocery drinks and other shop items to resell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.es:
Jane tiene 34 años de edad, trabaja como empleada en un grifo de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo saca adelante a su pequeño de 7 años de edad, a quien ama muchísimo.

Jane esta agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda los prestamistas kiva ya que Jane podrá comprar un pequeño terreno para poder construir su casa, así de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old. She is an employee at a petrol station in her city and with the income from her basic job she brings up her 7-year-old son, whom she loves very much. 

Jane is grateful for the support she gets from the Kiva lenders as she will be able to buy a small plot of land to build her house on. This means she will be able to keep striving towards making her big dream come true: to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three daughters. Her children go to the local school. 

Khatuna and her husband are unemployed now. The family lives in poverty, though it gets a pension from the government as being in poverty. Sometimes their relatives give them money for food. 

Khatuna has requested a loan several times, but her attempts were all rejected because of not having a stable income and her lack of experience. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, enables her to get a loan for starting a business. 

She will purchase dairy cows, will milk every day, and will produce dairy products to sell and to feed her children. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 61 years old and widowed, with two children.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks, like soap, milk, sugar, and spices.

Luciana has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years.

Luciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like soap, milk, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une jeune femme mariée avec un docker et a un enfant âgé de 3ans. Elle est revendeuse et revend des parfums, des ustensiles de cuisine et du sucre à tous types de personnes. Par manque de liquidité, elle sollicite son premier prêt chez WAGES pour l’achat et la vente des parfums, des ustensiles de cuisines et du sucre. Elle espère à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique. Elle a débuté son activité en Janvier 2013.
texts.en:
Abla is a young woman who is married to a docker. They have a 3-year-old child. She is a retailer who sells perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar to a mixed clientele. She started her business in January 2013.

Short on cash, Abla is seeking a first loan from WAGES to support her activity of buying and selling perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar. 

In the long term, she would like to open a store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, kitchen utensils and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Oristila

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza  de 26  años de edad es casada,  tiene dos hijos  que dependen de ella  sus  hijos tienen  08 y 06 años, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia.
Doña Martiza se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de tamales y pan y queso, su venta es ambulante y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que visita en sus casas.
Doña Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y desea sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de hojas de plátano, maíz, harina, leña y gallinas que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea obtener  ganancias que le permitan ir mejorando su casa,  es su sexto préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es mejorar su casa  y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 years old and is married, with 2 dependent children aged 8 and 6. They live in the community of San Lorenzo in the South of Honduras and have their own house. For 5 years Maritza has been earning a living selling tamales and bread and cheese. She works as a street vendor, selling to friends and people who she visits in their homes. She is a hard working woman and wants to bring her family up well. 

Maritza is asking for the loan to buy banana leaves, corn, flour, firewood and chicken, which are the raw materials for preparing her tamales. With the help of this loan she wants to make profits which will enable her to make improvements to her home. This is the sixth loan she has requested. Her dream is to improve her home and business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy banana leaves, corn, flour, firewood and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married, with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Helen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maira Yecenia

texts.es:
Doña Maira tiene una edad de 33 años es agricultora y ama de casa madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su esposo y los apoyan con todas las diferentes actividades que diariamente realizan en los cultivos de café. Tiene un grado de educación secundario completo el cual pudo lograr gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo económico de sus padres con los cuales ella se siente muy agradecida. Ella en compañía de su esposo el cual es maestro de educación primaria se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que diariamente ellos trabajan duro para sacar a sus hijos adelante, enseñarles el valor del trabajo e inculcarle buenos principios como el respeto y la honestidad ya que estos dos principios sobre salen en el ámbito del negocio para obtener buenas relaciones con sus clientes. Sus clientes son intermediarios, bodegas, pulperías, familiares y amigos que viven en la zona o llegan a la misma para para la adquisición de su producto.
Ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara abono (12 quintales de 18-46-0) y 9 quintales de urea para proteger y abonar sus cultivos de maíz, frijol y café ya que de esa forma ella podrá dar una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos. 
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café ya que la tierra que ellos tienen es propia y apta por su clima localidad y mantenimiento para el mismo. Su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que ellos tengan muchas opciones y oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, a farmer, housewife, and mother of four children who all live with her and her husband.  They support them with all their different daily activities related to raising coffee.  She has a junior high school education and she was able to achieve this thanks to the efforts and her parents’ financial support.  She is very grateful to them.  She and her husband, who is an elementary school teacher, raise and harvest coffee and they work hard every day to get their children ahead, teach them the value of work, and good values such as respect and honesty.  These are the principles that they use in their business to have good relationships with their customers.  Her customers are intermediaries, shops, stores, family, and friends who live in the area or go there to acquire their product.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy fertilizer (12 quintals of 18-46-0) and nine quintals of urea to protect and fertilize her corn, bean, and coffee crops.  This way she can better help her crops.

Her plans for the future are to be able to raise a better variety of coffee, since they have their own farmland and good because of the local climate and soil.  Her dream is to be able to provide a good education for her children so that they will have many options and opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice and planting cassava. Chanthou has been a farmer for almost ten years and she earns about 24,000 KHR per day. She successfully used her first loan with VisionFund to improve her livelihood.

Chanthou is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farm. This will be her second loan. In the future, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sales so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia, age 40, is married and lives with his wife, retired mother and two school-age children in the Black Sea coastal town of Kobuleti. Gia is an internally displaced person and gets modest monthly social assistance from the government. His wife works as a baker at the local bakery, earning a modest salary.

Gia is a house painter and works on renovations, but his income is unstable, dependent as it is on customer orders. To increase his income, he has  requested this Start Up loan to purchase a parquet flooring machine so he can work on floor covering installations as well. According to his estimations, his earnings will double and he will be able to provide his family members with better living conditions. 

Gia hopes that Kiva lenders will be helpful to him.

loans.use: to purchase a parquet flooring machine

loans.name: Saet's Group

texts.en:
Saet, who is 56 years old, is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She is a widow and the mother of three children.

To strive for a living, she grows rice, cassava, and cashews as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Saet is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), and she has successfully repaid back the past loans already. 

The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to provide decent food for her family and promptly supported her business in a timely way. She leads a group consisting of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. 

She and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of KHR 1,100,000 each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farming and to pay plowing and transplantation fees. 

With this loan, she hopes to make a good income so she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farming

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en:
Man, 43, is married with six children, residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Three of the children are still in school. 

To support the family, Man has been selling fish and working for others for a fee. She and her husband having been in this business for almost 20 years. 

Man’s Group consists of two members who are both female and they both have been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles. Man completely paid back the loans with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loans to provide better support to her family. 

Man and her group member are applying for a new loan. Man will use her portion to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Som Art's Group

texts.en:
Som Art, a citizen from Dambae district, is 41 years old and a married mother of one son, who still counts on her. 

For 20 years, she has been growing cassava and cashews as a main source of income. 

This is Som Art’s fourth loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund Cambodia. The past loans have enabled her to improve her living conditions. 

For this cycle, Som Art is seeking a loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000, while her co-borrower is applying for a loan of  KHR 1,200,000.

As the leader, Som Art will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her cassava and cashew plantation. She expects to double her crop yield, to sell at a good price, so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her plantation.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is studying business administration at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City.  Her mother, a widow with four chldren who attend school, is the only one earning an income for the family. She sells coconuts in town to make a living. The children help their mother on weekends in her business and with household chores. 

Catherine is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy school materials, books, etc. She hopes to finish her studies and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school materials needed for the first semester

loans.name: Dathe

texts.fr: Dathe est un jeune homme célibataire âgé de 35ans. Il est un enseignant et pratique la vente et l’achat des matériels informatiques et d’ordinateurs.  Il exerce son activité dans une boutique. Il sollicite un premier prêt chez WAGES pour réinvestir dans son activité pour l’achat, la vente de matériels informatiques et d’ordinateurs. Il souhaite assurer  son activité et la voir grandir et assurer l’avenir de sa famille plus tard. Il a commencé à exercer depuis 2012.
texts.en:
Dathe is a single, 35-year-old teacher. He buys and sells computers and accessories out of a store. He started this activity in 2012. 

Dathe is seeking a first loan from WAGES to invest in his business. He would like to make his activity sustainable and see it expand so as to provide for a family in the future.

loans.use: to buy computers and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a hardworking and enterprising man who is still single. For the past three years, he has operated a kiosk where he sells items to his neighbors and passersby. Kelvin’s major business challenge is price fluctuation. He lives in his own house without electricity or running water. Kelvin decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Kelvin is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell. In the future, he dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets to sell

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary is married and a young mother of two children, both of whom are too young for school. She is a resident of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. For the past six years, Theary has been a cassava famer. This is the main source of her family’s income. Theary has successfully borrowed and repaid five previous loans with the Kiva partner VisionFund. She used her past loans to improve her family’s living conditions. 

Theary is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her crop and pay for plowing fees and labor costs for her farm. She hopes to increase her high cash-crop yields and get a good selling price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labors costs for her farm

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 22-year-old single man. He has worked as a plumber for the past nine years to help supplement his parents' income and to cover the cost of his educational fees. He was only 13 years old when he started working, and now he has deep experience in his field.
 
In 2008, he started his own business providing his services to several customers in his region. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his university tuition fees. He will also use part of the loan to pay for his brothers' school fees, to make sure that they will keep on getting the necessary education they need for a brighter future.

He hopes to graduate soon and to start working in his field of study, and prove his abilities.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees and his brothers' education fees

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen is a 19-year-old student at Stella Maris College who is studying business administration to earn a Bachelor of Science degree. Her mother is the only one earning an income for her family as her father has died. Kathleen’s family runs a business buying and selling coconuts to make a living. She has three siblings and providing for school fees and education is not easy. She and her siblings help their mother on the weekends in her business and by doing household chores.

Kathleen is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy school materials, books, and other items. In the future, she dreams of finishing her studies and becoming successful.

loans.use: to buy school materials, books, and other items

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children and  he has been doing farming work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Gilbert stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "mixed farming." His biggest challenge is: "crop diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Null."

Gilbert was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "They help us grow."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked: "how will this loan benefit his family?," Gilbert replied: "increase sources of income."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Gilbert owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and bicycle,' but he does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, and running water,' but he does not have: 'electricity, sewing machine, TV or DVD.'

loans.use: to pay for construction of a green house.

loans.name: Kwa Ndevu Group

texts.en: Fatuma, who is in her mid 30s, is married and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. For the last 11 years, she has had a tailoring business and a shop where she sells clothes. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She lives in Tujijenge Tanzania, and this is her second loan request. She will use the loan to buy materials to make more clothes and buy more sarongs to resell. Fatuma used her previous loans to buy more tailoring materials, fabrics and sarongs and paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to help pay school fees and household expenses. She dreams of improving and upgrading her shop. Fatuma will share this loan with her group Kwa Ndevu, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more clothes and buy more sarongs to resell.

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en:
Latifan is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Latifan has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to do some engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services for his passengers. 

Latifan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Yawoavi est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un électricien frigoriste et a 5 enfants tous scolarisés dont le premier a 20ans et le dernier 8ans. Elle a commencé à exercer depuis 2003. Elle est revendeuse de sachets plastiques et de divers au grand marché. Elle demande un troisième prêt pour la vente de ses sachets plastiques, réinjecter les profits dans l’activité pour espérer l’ouverture d’une boutique. Elle désire assurer la bonne scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawoavi, age 40, is married to a refrigeration electrician. They have five children aged 8 to 20 years old who have all received schooling. 

Yawoavi sells plastic bags and various products at the market. She started this activity in 2003. 

She is seeking a third loan to help support her business. She plans to reinvest her profits in her activity and hopes to open a store at some point in the future. She also wants to ensure a proper education for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Iskender

texts.en:
Iskender is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International Comparative Politics and here is his story.

“The faculty of International Comparative Politics came to my mind when I was in 10th Grade.
