texts.en: Fahri, 45, is a married man with three children between the ages of 13-17 years old. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo. In order to make a living, he is working as a guard and his wife is a cleaner working for a private family. Both of them earn a small income that is not enough to do the renovations that he has wanted for a long time. Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to replace the doors of their home. The loan will help improve the living conditions for his family. His future goal is to be able to pay for a better education for the children. He would like to thank all of the lenders. He really appreciates this support and is very grateful for the financial support given to him to help his family.

loans.use: To buy new doors for his house

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a 35-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children who are not adults. All of them are already in school.

She is a teacher at the primary school. Her husband is also a teacher. He works at the same primary school where she works. They have small salaries. It does not allow her to provide for the needs of her family and build a new house because her family is large and needs a bigger house. This year she is going to build a new house with modern planning. She plans that her new house will have two bedrooms, a large living room and a verandah. 

This loan will help her buy building materials to build the new house. In this way she will provide high quality living conditions for her family and put an end to the problems with housing.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new house

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 44-year-old married mother of two children who has a small restaurant where she sells fast food. 

She works with her husband to make sure that their business is running properly, and to decrease the expense of requesting external employees. Hoda is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a motorcycle necessary for the restaurant to improve the free delivery services they provide to their customers. This service will attract new customers and increase their business productivity with low expenses.

In the future, Hoda is willing to open another branch in another region to expand her working zone.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle necessary to improve their free delivery services

loans.name: Agbogboé

texts.fr: Agbogboé est une dame âgée de 61ans, mariée à un retraité, elle a 3 enfants dont l’ainé a 32ans et le dernier a 25ans. Elle est revendeuse et vend du charbon de bois, du maïs et divers à tous clients. Par manque de liquidité pour la bonne marche de son activité elle sollicite un prêt chez WAGES pour l’achat et la vente de charbon de bois, de maïs et divers et espère avoir beaucoup de stock de charbon de bois. Elle exerce depuis 1998.
texts.en: Agbogboé is a 61-year-old woman who is married to a retired spouse. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 32 ​​years old and the youngest of whom is 25. She is a merchant who sells charcoal, corn and sundries to all types of customers. Due to the lack of liquidity she needs to run her business smoothly, Agbogboé is seeking a loan from WAGES so that she can purchase charcoal, corn and sundries for resale. She hopes to have a large stock of charcoal. She has been running her business since 1998.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, corn and sundries for resale.

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en: Lamia is a 44-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with four children, one of whom is working. She has been selling clothes from her home since 2011. Her only purpose is to help her children live in good standards. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase clothes for the winter season in large quantities and at good prices. More items to sell will result in better profits. In the future, she hopes to be able to become the owner of a proper clothing store where she will sell women's accessories in addition.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 22 years old and lives in Gaza with his family.

He opened a small garage in 2011 to repair motorcycles. This business is the main source of income for his small family. He earns around $900 monthly. Mahmoud needs this youth loan to buy a new repair kit and spare parts.

Mahmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him to get a step forward in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new repair kit and spare parts

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40  años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene tres hijos de 22, 19  y 12 años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio y vive con ella.
Doña María para salir adelante junto a su hija y darle lo mejor a ella se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, plátanos, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupada de sus tareas del colegio. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que con las  ganancias que obtiene de su negocio son  para el sustento diario y para gastos de los estudios de su pequeña así como también para aumentar su negocio ya que cada vez ella compra productos nuevos para así ganar más clientela. Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que le permite sacar adelante sola a su hija. 
Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “María Monserrate” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts; it’s known nationally and internationally and it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

María, 40, lives here.  She’s separated but has three children who are 22, 19 and 12 years of age; her youngest attends secondary school and lives with her.

To get ahead with her daughter and give her the best, she works in commerce.  She has a food market at home where she sells products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, bananas, vegetables, greens and fruit.  She works every day from 6am until  8pm and sometimes even later.  Her daughter helps her in the business when she’s not busy with school work.  She’s been in this business four years and they are getting ahead thanks to it.

She is repeating her loan because with profits earned from her business she’s able to cover basic daily needs and her little one’s schooling and also to increase business because every time she buys new products she gets new customers.

This loan will be used to buy food items to better stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because she started her business that supports her daughter with her first loan.  Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids. Her major business challenges include electricity outages, which hinder her business operations, and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She is aspiring to own a bridal salon and build her business premises.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Shemsije

texts.en: Shemsije is 45, married, and has two children ages 7 and 17 years old. They all live in a minority Roma community in Kosovo. Shemsije is a housewife and a stay-at-home mother, while her husband, who is the main source of the family's income, works in construction. This loving family lives in unacceptable conditions. They live in a small old house that has a serious problem with windows and doors, which means that during the rainy season and wintertime, they experience minor flooding, poor heat retention, drafts, and increased utility bills. Shemsije is requesting a loan to buy windows and doorframes for her house. The loan will improve the living conditions for her family. Shemsije is grateful to all Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy windows and doorframes for her house

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Isatu from the Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children between the ages of 11 years and 27 years. Two of her children are attending school. 

Isatu runs a food stand business; she sells rice, sugar, flour, and cooking seasonings. She started this business because she wanted to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband. She has been running this business since 2000. 

She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isatu says that the main challenges to her business are prices, transportation, and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, sugar, flour, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items, like rice, sugar, flour, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Maksat

texts.en:
Maksat has enrolled the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Business Law this year. Below he tells us how he decided to enter AUCA.

“In everyone’s life there comes a time to make important decisions that determine their future path. This is the issue of choice of profession. I have chosen the faculty of International and Business Law. The definition of law states that a lawyer is a person who practices law and delivers justice. The role of the lawyer varies significantly across legal jurisdictions. So, as regards to the above topic, I would like to become a lawyer. It is a profession which is to serve people. 

I think the American University of Central Asia will prepare me to become a highly qualified specialist in international and business law systems, because it is a modern university with a western system of education that prepares good experts. 

However, without any financial aid I will not be able to be part of it. I would be very grateful if you consider my candidacy for scholarship and give me an opportunity to acquire knowledge and also to realize my ambitions at AUCA.”

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Yanvaroy

texts.ru: Январой 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Январой имеет среднее педагогическое образование. Она после окончания педучилища поступила на работу в детский сад. Январой с 1980 года до сегодняшнего дня работает в детском саде и является одной из успешных педагогов. Она всегда выделяет огромное внимание для своих детей, особенно их образованию. Январой должна оплатить за учебного договора своего младшего сына Парвиза, который в этом году поступил на 1 курс. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Yanvaroy is 50 years old. She is married and raising five children. Yanvaroy has a vocational education in pedagogy. After finishing pedagogical school she started working in a kinder garden. From 1980 to today Yanvaroy has worked in this kinder garden and is one of the most successful pedagogues. 

Yanvaroy always gives her children a lot of attention, and especially their education. She needs to pay tuition for her youngest son, Parviz, who started his first year of studies this year. She requests a loan to pay for the tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi  est une femme célibataire âgée de 36ans sans enfants. Elle exerce dans la vente et la commercialisation des poissons frais et frits à tous clients. Elle sollicite son premier crédit chez WAGES pour acheter des poissons frais et frits. Elle espère  créer une  boutique de produits congelés. Elle a commencée depuis 2000. Elle exerce au marché.
texts.en: Akouavi is a single, 36-year-old woman with no children. She runs her business selling fresh and fried fish to all types of customers. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to purchase fresh and fried fish. She hopes to open a store where she would sell frozen products. Akouavi runs her business in the market, and has been a merchant since 2000.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Damla

texts.fr: Damla est une femme âgée de 50ans. Elle exerce depuis 2000 au marché dans le commerce d´ignames et de produit alimentaire général à toutes personnes. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi ; elle a un enfant âgée de 6ans. Elle s´approvisionne dans les marchés intérieurs ; elle sollicite son premier prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et élargir son étendu de vente.
texts.en: Damla is a 50-year-old woman. She has been running her business in the market selling yams and general food supplies to all types of customers since 2000. She is married to a taxi driver and she has a six-year-old child. She purchases her supplies in local markets, and is seeking her first loan to reinvest in her business and expand her sales territory.

loans.use: to purchase yams and general food supplies.

loans.name: Kanaiym

texts.ru: Канайым 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Канайым - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Канайым занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 лошади, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Kanaiym is 62 years old, and has raised four children together with her husband. Kanaiym has secondary education. As a source of income for her family, Kanaiym works with livestock breeding, after having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kanaiym's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow, two horses and 10 sheep. The monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kanaiym turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to increase the number of cattle. Kanaiym plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She plans to save money to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oranges to sell.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married to a carpenter with seven children, but her husband's income is not enough to take care of the home. 

Abibatu began her business because she wants to be independent. In 1998, she established her general stock business. She works at the business for nine hours per day, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, soap, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Abibatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, soap, and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and to pay household expenses.

loans.name: Tristan

texts.en:
Tristan is a 65-year-old pensioner from the village of Aragvispiri. He is divorced and lives alone in his old house. In spite of his age, Tristan works hard and is very energetic. He transports firewood from the forest and sells it among his villagers. The firewood is used as a fuel in wintertime in most of the Georgian villages, and now is a high season as people supply it to be ready for winter colds. Tristan has many orders, and he works all day long to satisfy their needs.

His earnings are modest, and Tristan gets a small sized monthly social assistance from the local government.
In order to improve his living conditions and generate more income, Tristan is requesting a credit to purchase a car and start a taxi business. He is an experienced and careful driver, and hopes his initiative will make money.

Tristan hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand car to use it as a Taxi.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 39-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife and two children in a small village in Ozurgeti district. 

Zaza is involved in agricultural activities. He has a plot of land where nut trees and walnut trees are grown. He is a very hard-working man and he always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

Zaza decided to start his own business and he requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 300 to purchase a welding machine. When the welding machine is purchased, he will work as a welder and he will increase the income of his family. 

The start-up program will be a great support to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and work as a welder.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 40-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, who are attending school. Her husband works at his town’s municipality, and she is a female hairdresser. She has been in this business since 2009. The couple works in partnership to collect money as much as they can to meet the life expenses. 

With her loan, requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase hairdressing tools and supplies. Noha is very optimistic, and she wishes to open her own beauty salon as soon as possible to welcome her customers in a well-organized setting.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Nassar

texts.en:
Nassar is a 26-year-old, single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and his only sibling. He cooperates with his father and sibling to pay the operating expenses. 

Nassar owns a bakery and he makes tasty pastries. Today, Nassar needs to receive a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to purchase raw materials, such as flour, sugar, and cooking oil to continue his operations and to increase his productivity. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season and he hopes that the loan will help him to increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his bakery.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, east of Freetown. She is single with one child who is one year old. In 2000, Aminata established her okara business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her child and parent. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy palm oil and a bag of okara to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and a bag of okara to expand her business.

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
Lirije is 49 years old, married, and a mother of two children, ages 14 and 24 years old, living in the southern part of Kosovo. 

For the last ten years, Lirije has been a seamstress for local customers in order to earn a living. She really enjoys her work and this helps her to have a lot of customers. Her husband is working in a factory as a worker, but with very low salary, so Lirije has had to add additional income to the family, besides her seamstress work, so she also works making cakes in a cake shop. 

Lirije is now requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy materials for her seamstress work. She hopes to earn a higher income by improving her seamstress business and she hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She is happy for the financial support from lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family. She appreciates this help!

loans.use: to buy materials for her seamstress work.

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
La Milagrosa está en su ciclo número 8º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1  de ellas se encuentra por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rafaela, quien es vendedora de comidas rápidas y comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y a las personas les gusta mucho. Se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace y el esfuerzo que hace por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás,  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“La Milagrosa” (The Miraculous One) is in cycle #8 in the women’s committee program.  All are working and helping each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and one of them is below the poverty line, that is to say with very low income.

One of the members is Rafaela who sells fast-food and comments that she does very well in her business because her dishes are delicious and people like them very much.  The work she does and the effort she puts into getting ahead and helping her family must be pointed out.

She’s asking for this loan to buy ingredients like meats, vegetables, condiments, and others to prepare her dishes which will help her reach her business plan that will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has six children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are from selling crops, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'banana planting!' Her biggest challenge is 'Tea picking.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Sindikisa.'

Dinah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They deal with farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Savings culture.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Dinah replied 'School fee payment will be easy.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dinah owns the following: cow, pump but does not own pig, poultry, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, TV but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Arasaty 2 Group

texts.es:
Arasaty 2 está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les ayudará a poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y así poder aplicar capacitaciones para poder ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, calzados, lencerías y eso le ayuda a tener su propio ingreso, se debe destacar el trabajo y esfuerzo que ella hace para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que sufrir.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de variadas clases, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que necesitan, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Arasaty 2” is taking the poverty elimination survey to help ascertain the situation each one of them is in and be able to provide training to improve it.

One of the members is María who sells clothes, shoes and lingerie which helps her earn income of her own.  The work she does and the effort she puts in to give her family everything they need so they’ll have no privations like she did is worthy of mention.

She’s asking for this loan to buy assorted clothes of all types to continue with her sales and offer customers what they need which will help her realize her business plan that will lead to higher income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La señora Nicanora tiene 54 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijas ya independientes a ella, tiene una despensa en su casa ubicada en la ciudad de Itá donde provee a sus clientes de yerba, bebidas en general, carne, panificados, lácteos, carbón, azúcar, arroz y otros insumos hace más de 10 años.
Ella cuenta que al principio le fue difícil empezar, pero poco a poco fue abriéndose camino y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela que compra de ella de manera frecuente, y así está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, panificados, lácteos, carbón, azúcar, arroz y otros para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Nicanora, 54, is married with two independent daughters.  She has a food mart located at home in the city of Itá where she’s been supplying her customers with herbal tea, beverages in general, meat, baked goods, dairy products, charcoal, sugar, rice and others for more than 10 years.

She relates that it was difficult to start at first but gradually she forged a path and today she has a very good clientele that buys from her frequently and this is how she’s getting ahead.

She’s asking for this loan to buy meat, baked goods, dairy products, charcoal, sugar, rice and others to be able to stock her store and continue offering a good variety to her customers.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with six children.  

In 2006, Memunatu established her local food business. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and, sometimes, vehicles break on the way.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and to increase her business. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Fransis

texts.en:
Fransis lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 43 years old and married with two children. For the last four years, he has been running a transport business that has been doing very well. 

He knew of Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to repair his vehicle that broke down. The challenge that he faces in the business is competition from other operators. He will use the extra income that he will raise to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle that broke down.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres emprendedoras  está trabajando por mejorar y salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres emprendedoras que quieren ayudar a sus familiares a  tener un mejor estilo de vida y a salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a la venta de periódicos y también a la elaboración de comestibles. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando, también gracias a las capacitaciones que va recibiendo.
La Sra. Juana solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir cocinando sus alimentos, como ser verduras, condimentos, huevos, pollo, y demás, con lo que quiere seguir mejorando su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women’s committee is working to improve and to get ahead.  They are enterprising women who want to help their families have better lifestyles and to get ahead.

One of the members is Juana who sells newspapers and also prepares food.  She’s a very self-sacrificing woman who with much effort and dedication and thanks too to the training she’s been getting has been able to grow and to improve.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy ingredients like vegetables, condiments, eggs, chicken, etc. to continue cooking her dishes in order to continue improving her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, eggs, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del grupo Sagrada Familia luchan y son incentivadas para mejorar sus ingresos para brindar un mejor bienestar a sus familias. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y que quieren salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucina, quien a través del esfuerzo y lucha constante y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella busca  mejorar su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles y cuenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela que gusta mucho de lo que ella prepara. Con mucho esfuerzo está creciendo y mejorando su economía y la de su familia.
La Sra. Lucina solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas.
texts.en:
All of the members of the “Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) group strive and are motivated to improve their income to provide improved family well-being.  They are very hardworking women who want to get ahead.

One of the members is Lucina who by means of effort and constant work and by applying the vital behaviors of successful women is seeking to improve her poverty situation.  She works selling food items and says she’s acquired a good clientele that enjoys what she makes very much.  With much effort she’s growing and improving her family’s economy.

Lucina’s asking for this loan to buy meats, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to continue making her meals.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2, east of Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2005, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a barber chair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fingerlings and fish feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children. They live in a six bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in living, like sickness and death of her love ones, attack by thieves, inadequate finance to start up a business of her own, and catering to her family's needs.

With this requested new loan, she will expand her shoe business by increasing the bags of shoes, renting a storeroom, and part of the loan will go for transportation. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time, and has regular customers who buy from her, especially during the months of September, February, and December. With this business activity, the community will benefit because she sells at moderate prices, she sells quality shoes, and the distance to buy from the market will be reduced.

The profit from this loan will be used for her family needs, to ensure her children are educated, and to provide medication for her family when needs arise. 

She prefers the GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy shoes, pay for her storeroom, and transport

loans.name: Jhonn

texts.es:
Jhonn es soltero, y no tiene hijos vive en una casa en alquiler  en la zona 8 de Diciembre) de la ciudad de La Paz.

El Nivel de educación de Jhonn es secundario, actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa de turismo en el cual percibe un sueldo mensual.
 
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de camping (tiendas de armar) para venderlo a los turistas que visitan el departamento de La Paz y así continuar con su negocio propio que poco a poco está dando ingresos extras.

El sueño de Jhonn es tener su propia empresa de turismo y mostrar la belleza de nuestro pais.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonn is single and doesn't have children. He lives in a rented house in the 8 de Diciembre neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

Jhonn's education level is secondary school. He currently works as the employee of a tourism company which pays him a monthly salary.

He needs the loan to buy camping equipment (assembly shopping) to sell it to tourists who visit the La Paz area, thus continuing his own business which, little by little, is giving him extra income.

Jhonn's dream is to have his own tourism business and show off the beauty of our country.

This is the third time he has asked for a loan through IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy mountaineering backpacks and equipment.

loans.name: Mirta Josibel

texts.es: Mirta, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene cuatro hijos y reside en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maíz. El préstamo que solicito es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de productos para la elaboración de las tortillas como ser: maíz, leña, bolsas, etc. Este préstamo le ayudara a poder crecer más con el negocio,  ya que tendrá más clientes y también hace tortillas para eventos como ser cumpleaños, bodas etc., y así podrá obtener más ganancias. Su meta es arreglar un poco mas su casa y  poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos con  los estudios.
texts.en:
Mirta, 33, is in a common law relationship with her husband and has four children; she lives in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Bárbara.  She’s been selling corn tortillas for 8 years.  The loan she asked for is for 10,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy supplies like corn, firewood, bags, etc. needed to make tortillas.  

This loan will help her grow more in business since she’ll have more customers.  She also makes tortillas for events like birthdays, weddings, etc. and will be able to earn higher profits this way.  Her goal is to make some home improvements and to be able to continue supporting her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy firewood, bags and corn.

loans.name: Edgar Missael

texts.es: Edgar, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa en el municipio de Protección, Santa Barbara.  Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la  agricultura produciendo café, maíz y frijoles. El prestamo que solicito es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la finca y ya con esto podr obtener mejores cosechas. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Edgar, 22, is in a common law relationship and lives with his wife in the municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He’s been working in agriculture ten years growing coffee, corn and beans.  He requested an 8,000 Lempira loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his farm in order to get better crop yields.  His goal is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Orlando

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 35 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Protección, Santa Barbara.  Hace 20 años se dedica a la  agricultura. Produce  café, maíz y frijol. El prestamo que solicito es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la finca de café y  asi poder tener  mejores es cosechas ya que  es su única fuente de ingresos. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en: Jorge, 35, lives with his wife and three children in the municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He’s been working in agriculture 20 years growing coffee, corn and beans.  He requested an 8,000 Lempira loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his coffee crop to get higher crop yields since this is his only source of income.  His goal is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 41 years old. She is married and lives in the Black Sea coastal city of Barumi with her husband and two grown sons. Natia’s husband and elder son work as security guards in return for small-sized monthly salaries. The family doesn’t have any other source of income, and unfortunately the guard salaries are not enough to cover food and daily costs. 

Natia has made multiple loan requests, without success, from the local financial institutions in order to start up a trading business. Her loan requests were rejected each time due to low income. Now, Natia’s loan request has been approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and restart-ups with loans with soft conditions. Borrowers are the vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as "high-risk borrowers" because of their low income. 

With the loan, Natia will rent the store, install shelves and purchase merchandise for setting up a general store. She will buy a variety of household and daily consumer products and sell them from her store. Natia hopes her project will be profitable and generate income for improving the family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to start up a general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a loan she has and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es soltera, vive con sus dos hijas que le colaboran con los gastos de la casa ya que son profesionales, vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la iudad de La Paz.

El Nivel de educación de Elisa es secundario, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de masitas (repostería) las cuales vende por mayor en las tiendas de barrio del sector.
 
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital y comprar harina y otros insumos al por mayor para ahorrar costos y elaborar mayor cantidad de sus productos.

El sueño de Elisa es tener una tienda de reposteria grande de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elisa is single and lives with her two daughters, who are already professionals and help her with household expenses. She lives in her own house in the city of La Paz's Tacagua neighborhood.

Elisa's education level is secondary, and she currently earns her living making pastries, which she sells wholesale in neighborhood stores.

She needs the loan to increase her capital and buy flour and other inputs wholesale, to save costs and create a greater number of her products.

Elise's dream is to have a large pastry store, in this way improving her income and her quality of life.

This is the second time she's asked for a loan through IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour and other inputs for making different types of bread and sweets.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is a 59-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter in a small village of the Sachkhere District. Zina is a very hard working woman. She has poultry business, raising hens to sell. Her husband and son work physically and receive a small monthly income. 

Zina decided to purchase a cow and start a dairy business. The start-up loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,100 GEL to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase her family income, and they will be able to improve their living conditions as a result.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Isata from Waterloo2, an eastern area of Freetown. She is single with one child who is two years old. In 2009, Isata established her snack business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well, because out of the profit she is able to take care of her child and herself.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase chicken, fish and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. Isata plans to live the business and learn something for her future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, fish and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with ten children, and seven go to school. She has two additional family members. 

She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for seven years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from offering outside catering and  teaching. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, cooking oil, and rice. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, and beans

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 82 years old and widowed, with nine children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in the Likoni area, which is south of Mombasa. 

She has been running a water business for more than two years. She sells water to the locals for an income. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and she joined so that she could access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to build a water storage tank. 

She hopes that in the next five years she will be able to open more branches of her business, despite the challenge of water rationing. 

She will use the extra income to improve her business and improve her standards of living, too.

loans.use: to build a water storage tank

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
Onua Do group is located on the outskirts of Teshie Township. The group members are basically involved in small scale retail sales of such products as yams, milk, wax prints, maize, plastic plates and bags. They have an average age of 30 years and average three children each.

Bernard is a 35-year-old married man and a father of three. His main business is to supply yams to foodstuff sellers in Accra. He buys the items from the northern part of the country where he comes from and supplies customers in Accra where he lives. He has all three children going to school. Bernard is sometimes supported by his wife, who has also been trading in vegetables since 2005. His main clients are foodstuff traders in Accra.

Bernard is determined to use his loan request amount of GHS 1,000 from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to change his life and benefit his family by investing it in his yam business. He is on his forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and has repaid all previous loan without trouble.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 10,100 so that they can increase stock and serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy and supply yams to foodstuff sellers in Accra.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products like lotions and ornaments.

loans.name: María Amanda

texts.es:
María de 69 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, ya mayores de edad y que posee sus propios hogares uno de ellos vive en la comunidad, dos viven en la capital y uno esta en los estados unidos de América.

Ella estudio hasta segundo grado, se acompaño a los 19 años de edad con su esposo y se casaron en el año 2000.
vivieron 20 años en la capital del país donde ella cuidaba de sus hijos mientras su esposo trabajo, todos esos años en una empresa de energía eléctrica; luego él se jubilo y se regresaron a la comunidad de donde son originarios, y se dedicaron a los trabajos de la agricultura y ganaderia.

Su esposo murió en el año 2002 de causas naturales, y hoy en día solo vive con 3 nietos a quienes cuida y son ellos quienes le ayudan en los trabajos de la agricultura, en los tiempos libre pues uno de ellos trabaja, otro estudia en la comunidad y el otro es enfermito y tiene que estar pendiente de él.
De su esposo recibe una pensión mensualmente y sus hijos siempre están pendiente de ella.


Por su parte,  desde pequeña se creció en los quehaceres del hogar, y sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles, maicillo y los trabajos del cultivo de mezcal), ademas cuidaba del ganado en el hogar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, piedras y el pago de la mano de obra, pues necesita empedrar y fraguar una calle del terreno, donde ella vive la cual conecta con la carretera principal, ademas de hacer otras mejoras en la vivienda, estima que invertirá para ello $1000.00 y el resto lo necesita pues tiene pendiente unos gastos personales.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, mientras tenga fuerzas en la agricultura y seguir motivando a sus nietos para estudiar y que salgan adelante-
texts.en:
María, 69, is mother of four adult children who have homes of their own.   One of them lives in the community, two live in the capital and one is in the United States of America.  She completed second grade and at the age of 19 got together with her husband; they were married in the year 2000.

For 20 years they lived in the nation’s capital where she raised her children while her husband worked all those years for an electric energy company.  Later, he retired and they returned to the community they came from originally and started working in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Her husband died in the year 2002 of natural causes and today she lives with three grandchildren she cares for and who help her with the agricultural chores in their free time for one of them is employed, the other attends school in the community and the other one is ill and she has to care for him.  She gets her husband’s monthly pension and her children are always watching over her.

On her part, since her childhood she grew up doing housework and her parents taught her how to work in the fields (to plant corn, beans, sorghum and agave).  She also took care of the cattle at home.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy sand, cement and stone and to pay labor costs because she needs to flatten and pave a street on her property that connects to the main highway as well as to do some other home improvements.  She figures she’ll spend $1,000 on this and will use the rest for some pending personal expenses she has.

Her dream is to continue working in agriculture as long as she has strength to do so and to continue motivating her grandchildren to study and to move forward.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo2, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  

In 2001, Mbalu established her palm oil business. She began her business to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mbalu requires a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living, and increase her business. 

In the future, Mbalu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Adama from Waterloo2, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child, age 7. She started this business to sustain her life.

Adama runs a medical drug business with the community; she has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Adama says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient financing to expand her business.

Adama has requested a loan to buy more medical drugs to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional stock of motor-vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is single, with two children. She has no additional family members. 

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for one year. She works six days a week.  She gets additional income from selling fried cassava chips, at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child. 

In 2011, Kadiatu established her general stock business.  She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m., Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and open a savings account. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old. She is married and has four children.  Two are married, and two are still studying. She lives in Delapa Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte.

Anita owns a parcel of rice field, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,000.  She has requested a new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for maintenance so she can harvest abundantly. 

Anita has been a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC for three years.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Om Shanti Group

texts.en:
Runukar, aged about 35 years, is the group leader for a four-member group from Bissam Cuttack, a town situated in Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of three members, her husband and their 12-year-old son. The member standing on the extreme left with raised hand is Runukar. At present she is running a tailoring shop in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Runukar is a tailor. During 2010, she, along with three other members from her village formed a group and for the first time they took out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses. Runukar’s husband does seasonal business. At present her family income is Rs.4,500  per month which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a Pico Machine. She has a dream to educate her only son in a better school for better education and have a shop of her own.

The other three members named Ranjita, Sumitra and Subashini have a grocery shop, tailoring and Leaf plate businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico Machine

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Jharana is the leader of a group that hails from Bissam Cuttack of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 35 years of age. She has a small family comprised of four members including one daughter and one son, aged 12 and 16 years respectively. The member standing second from right with raised hand is Jharana. 

Jharana manages a small grocery shop in her locality. Her husband does seasonal business in her village moving from market to market. In 2010 Jharana, along with other three members from her locality, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for develop their existing businesses. This is the third loan for Jharana from Mahashakti Foundation.  

At the time of accessing her first loan, her husband was accustomed to attend weekly markets of nearby villages for seasonal business. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a low profile way. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, Jharana accessed a second loan and constructed a shed in her house and started selling grocery items. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her grocery shop significantly. At present her monthly income is Rs.5,000 but that is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a further loan to add some extra items like rice, pulses (lentils), sugar, tea, flour, oil and other grocery items.  She has a cherished dream to educate her children in a better school/college so they can get employment in the government sector.

The other three members are Susila, who has a fast food centre, and Sujata and Labanyabati who make and sell leaf plates.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pulses (lentils), sugar, tea, flour, oil and other grocery items

loans.name: Soumaya

texts.en:
Soumaya is a 45-year-old married mother of two children who has had a shoe selling shop for thirteen years. Soumaya supports her family financially, since her husband’s income is very low and isn’t enough to cover their family’s increasing needs.

Soumaya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a special new autumn and winter collection to address her customers' needs and increase her income.

This is Soumaya’s first loan as an Al Majmoua borrower, and in the future she also expects to have loans; she is willing to expand her business through diversifying her products.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special autumn and winter collection

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu is married with three children and two go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon from home. She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

Sanyu has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy hair treatments, weaves, relaxers, braids and hair extensions. Her major business challenges include undependable electricity which hinders her business operations. She is aspiring of getting permanent business premises.  She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy hair treatments, relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 49 years old and married.  She has nine children, three of them are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dionisia has an oyster culture business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to  buy raw materials like binder, fishing nets, and bamboo.

Dionisia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like binder, fishing nets, and bamboo.

loans.name: Sai Krupa Group

texts.en:
Basanti, a widow of 46 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Bissum Cuttack of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She has one son and one daughter aged 25 and 18, respectively. The member standing at the extreme right with her hand raised is Basanti. 

Basanti is managing a small grocery shop in her locality. During 2011, Basanti, along with three other members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. This is the second cycle loan.  

At the time of availing the first loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her daily needs. Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now, she is very confident in running her business and has developed her grocery shop significantly. At present, her monthly income is about 9,000 INR. She wants to take a further loan to purchase rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger and other grocery items. She wishes for her daughter to get married into a respectable family.

Of the other three members, Pramila and Pallibala are doing brick businesses and Krushnabasini is dealing with a rice business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger and other grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic goods and hardware items

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 years and 18 years old.  In 2012, Fatmata established her charcoal business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and price changes.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future; Fatmata plans to change her business to a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children. In 2002, Rugiatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to strive for her living. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina de 53 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, se caso a los 18 años de edad, con quien ha convivido hasta este día, juntos han trabajado muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, cuatro de ellos ya se casaron y tienen sus propias familias. En la casa de habitación solo vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan a ella en el hogar.

Sus hijos todos son bachilleres y no ha seguido apoyándolos en los estudios universitarios, por falta de dinero.
Bernardina, no estudio pues sus padres no quisieron, enviarla a estudiar ni a sus otros cinco hermanos que ella tiene.


Ella se dedica desde los 20 años de edad, a la elaboración de hamacas, pues ella asistió a un taller en el municipio en donde aprendió y con el paso de los años ella ha ido perfeccionando el arte. Antes hacia hamacas de cascarilla, ahora hace hamacas de seda y de poliseda, elabora  un promedio de 5 a 6 hamacas en el mes y las comercializa en la ciudad, donde también compra el material, esto le toma 30 minutos caminando hasta donde tiene que ir a tomar el bus y luego hace 30 minutos en el bus para llegar a la ciudad.

 Compra cada 15 o 22 días el material para elaborar las hamacas. Se dedica hacer las hamacas después de los quehaceres del hogar, por las tardes, sus hijos también le ayudan cuando vienen de trabajar la agricultura.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para comprar una caja de hilo de seda, el cual esta valorada en $450 y el resto para otros gastos del hogar. Con ello,  podrá elaborar mas hamacas y tendrá mas ofertas para los clientes, pues en la temporada de noviembre y diciembre hay mas demanda por la época navideña.


El sueño, es seguir trabajando cada día mas, para elaborar mas hamacas y poder vender mas.
Ademas sueña mejorar su vivienda, ya que las paredes y el piso es de tierra, esto lo lograra poco a poco mediante las ganancias que espera percibir de las ventas de las hamacas, esta ahorrando para ello.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 53 years old and the mother of six grown children.  She married when she was 18 and is still together with her husband to this day.  Together they have worked very hard so their kids could get ahead.  Four of them are married and have their own families. She now lives with her husband and only two of their children who work and help around the house.

Her children have all graduated from high school and she has not continued supporting them with university studies because she doesn't have the money. Bernarda did not go to school because her parents didn't want to send her or her five other siblings. She has been working at making hammocks since the age of 20.  She went to a workshop in her town where she learned, and over time she has perfected the art. She used to make the hammocks from husks, but now she uses silk and poly silk.  She makes 5 or 6 hammocks per month and sells them in the city where she also buys the materials.  It takes her 30 minutes to walk to where she catches the bus, and the ride into the city takes another 30 minutes. 

She buys the materials to make the hammocks every 15 or 20 days and she makes them in the afternoon after finishing her household chores. Her children help her after they return from working in agriculture.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy a box of silk yarn which costs $450 and she will use the rest for household expenses. With the loan, she will be able to make more hammocks and provide a better selection for her customers. In November and December demand increases because of the Christmas holidays. 

Her dream is to continue working more each day so she can make and sell more hammocks. She also dreams of improving her house since the walls and floor are made of dirt.  She will achieve this bit by bit with the earnings she hopes to make from the sale of her hammocks, and she is saving up for this.

loans.use: to buy a box of silk yarn which is valued at $450, and she will use the rest  for other household expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fence his farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. El cliente  vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Él posee una venta de frutas y verduras, su venta la tiene instalada en la cama de un pick up el cual esta ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, desde hace 2 años, su compañera de vida  le ayuda con el negocio. El cliente  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, papas, chiles verdes, tomates, etc. ya que de esta manera él  podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, así obtener mejores ganancias y  darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The client is a very hardworking man who is fully invested in his business.  His sole desire is to get ahead and offer his family a better life.  He lives with his wife and their son in their own house.  He has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for 2 years.  He operates it from the back of a pickup truck that is located in the town market near his house.  His wife helps him with his business.

The client is asking for a loan so he can buy papaya, bananas, pineapple, potatoes, green chiles, tomatoes, and other things.  In this way, he will be able to sell more (which is his main priority) and obtain greater profits.  By so doing, he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: buy papaya, bananas, pineapple, potatoes, green chiles, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 38 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vivian has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair her weed eater.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, aged 2 and the youngest three months old. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya, where he also does his business. 

He is a fruit vendor, and he has been in this business for the past four years. He knew Milango through friends and decided to join so that he could save and be able to access credit and fund his business. 

He now seeks a loan to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and watermelon for his business. The challenge in the business is price changes. 

He hopes that in the next five years he will be running a wholesale business.  He plans to use the extra income he will raise to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and watermelon

loans.name: Four Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Tendai from Harare. She is a widow, with two children, both attending school.  She also looks after her parents. 

She is a member of the Four Sisters Group. Tendai runs a clothing business, selling jeans, dresses, trousers, and groceries. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition with other traders. 

Tendai has requested a loan of $750 to buy new trousers, jeans, and groceries like baked beans and cooking oil for resale. 

She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and pay school fees. 

In the future Tendai plans to have her own buildings.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He has worked in the construction field for the past seven years. He got involved in this business at an early age in order to help his parents pay the operating costs. He works as a painter, and he is well talented at his job. 

Today, and in order to improve his business, Ali seeks to purchase an electrical generator. To do so, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

He states that this generator will unquestionably let him continue his operations properly and will help him generate good profits. This is his first Kiva loan, and he hopes to be able to satisfy his clients' demands and get superior financial benefits.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is married with four children, and two are in school. She takes care of an additional family member (her mother). 

She sells charcoal on a retail basis.  She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the rainy season, which hinders her movements and transportation. 

She aspires to build rental houses.  She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster-culture business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials for her oyster-culture business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  es madre soltera vive con su hijo en casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y honesta desde hace  2  años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto en su lugar  residencia. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, la clienta ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: The client is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son. She is a hard-working, responsible and honest woman who for the past two years has been raising cattle at her place of residence. She has good clients as she knows how to win their confidence. The client has decided to invest in caring for her cattle, as this is what her business depends on.  She has requested a loan so she can buy vitamins and concentrated feed. She wants to be able to unconditionally give her son a better quality of living,

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wholesale natural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and married, with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for six years, and she also earns additional income from a repair shop and general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de agua de cocos, su negocio o tiene ubicado en las afueras de su municipio desde hace 10 años, posee mucha clientela por ser un lugar muy transitado por personas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  José esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor para poder tener los necesarios cuando le lleguen a comprar y así aumentar sus ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He sells coconut water.  He has had his business, which is located on the outskirts of the municipality, for ten years. He has a lot of clients as it is a busy area. With what he gets from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. 

Jose is requesting a loan to buy coconuts wholesale in order to have enough when people come to buy. He wants to increase his profits and offer his family a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, shirts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who attend school. 

He has owned a store since 2007, where he sells mirrors and glass products. He has worked in this type of business for the past 22 years. 

Today, and in order to increase his store’s inventory, Ibrahim wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

He notes that the loan will surely assist in increasing his business sales and consequently his profits. 

Ibrahim is very ambitious and intends to work harder, so as to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their requirements.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the poultry yard and expand it.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who are attending school. 

She has been working at producing hand-made products since 2008. She is very talented and creates unique designs. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees. (She intends not to argue with the school management regarding the financials and to maintain a good relation with the whole team so as to guarantee an excellent educational path for her children in an agreeable environment.)

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy polythene bags and retail commodities

loans.name: Jezail

texts.en:
Jezail is 19 years old and single, from Bethlehem city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her father is a worker with a low wage. 

Jezail finished her high school study this summer. She would like to go to the unversity and study tourism and hospitality, but her father does not have enough money to pay the university expenses.

Jezail has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to improve herself and find a better job in the future. 

Jezail appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married, with four children; two are in  school. She has no additional family members to care for. 

She sells fish at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for three years. She works six days a week.  She gets additional income from selling fruits and vegetables at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy fish. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She aspires to educate her children to the university level.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: T o buy more fish

loans.name: Alphunsina

texts.en:
Alphunsina is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for eight years and works seven days a week.  

Alphunsina has applied for a loan of  600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy bale of second hand shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspires to get a permanent business premise.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Adama from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with eight children. In 2003, Adama established her soap business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business twelve hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil and soap to increase her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Adama plans to change her business to a food stand business. She thanks you for your support.
